Seydina est jeune commerçant qui gère une boutique au quartier Medina Falls de THIES. Il est célibataire et vit chez ses parents. Avec ce pret il veut acheter des marchandises pour renforcer ses stocks et satisfaire davantage la demande de ses principaux clients.

loans.use: Purchase of products for his store

loans.name: Kudiratu

texts.en: Kudiratu O. is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City with her husband and children. Kudiratu has been in this business of selling provisions and drinks since 1978. She learned this business for a year from her mother. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. Kudiratu is a LAPO client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda M. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has secondary education and stays at home. She had been growing rice for the past 3 years. This allows her not to purchase rice, which is usually expensive, on a market. She mainly uses her crops for her own family and sells any extras. At this point in time, Mavjuda would like to purchase quality seeds for the next sowing. After consulting with her family, she decided to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Мавжуда Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 31 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее ,домохозяйка. Клиентка более 3 лет занимается посевом риса. Это позвляет ей не покупать на рынке рис,который стоит дорого, Свой урожай она использует для своих нужд , а лишнее реализует на рынке. В данный момент Мавжуда хочет закупить качественные семена для повторного посева. Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase quality seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  clothes, loincloths and other products

loans.name: Mrs. Much Non's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Much N. is the leader of this group of four. They now live in O'Rum Chek Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Much N. is a basket maker who can earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bu Sao, owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Unfortunately, Mr. Bu Sao now faces a small problem because his rice field is infertile, which affects his crop. To solve this problem, his wife decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to enrich the field in order to make the crop more productive. Mrs. Much N. is 45 years old and the mother three children. One of the children is a farmer, while the others are attending the local school. 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, and they are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva’s Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the field in order to make the crop more productive

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Baji is the wife of M. R. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen Baji’s husband has a grocery shop near the community. People of her community come to him and buys groceries. His monthly income is $120. Nasreen Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zafran Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Noor Baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell. Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, sketches and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en el colegio D. la ciudad. Cuando era niña se dedicaba a pastar el ganado D. sus padres, y desD. que se casó cambió su actividad para dedicarse mayormente a su casa; su esposo es profesor. Pero ahora que sus hijos ya crecieron ella no pueD. estar sin realizar alguna actividad, por ello empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura, actividad que le agrada mucho y les es muy rentable, sobre todo en tiempos D. cosecha, donD. negocia sus productos. Le es dificultoso en las épocas D. siembra y cosecha, ya que ella solo no se abastece, y a veces no encuentra peones que le ayuden. Le tiene mucha gratitud a su IMF, porque dice que  le han permitido tener independencia económica. Con este, es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y durante todo este tiempo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero va comprar abono D. corral para que pueda sembrar, ya que tiene semilla guardada y quiere hacerla producir.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old, is married and has two children who are studying in the high school in the city. When she was a child she worked putting her parents' cattle out to pasture and since she married she changed her activity to work primarily at home; her husband is a professor. But now that her children are already grown she cannot be without carrying out some activity which is why she started to work in agriculture, which she likes very much and is very profitable, above all in harvest times when she negotiates her products. It is difficult for her in periods of planting and harvesting as she cannot do it all herself and sometimes she does not find laborers to help her. She is very grateful for her IMF, because she says it has allowed her to have economic independence. With this, itis her seventh loan with MFP, and during all of this time she demonstrated punctuality with her payments. With this money she will buy animal manure to help her grow, as she has seed stored and wants to make it produce.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Vay

texts.en: Mrs. Vay Y. is 44 years old and a rice farmer who lives in Koh Village. She has been farming since 1980 and is married with three children; one is employed and the other helps with the family's farm. Her husband is a construction worker and being mobile is one of the requirements of his job. Rice farming is the main source of income for the family and she is responsibility of caring for the farm. She is requesting a loan to purchase three oxen to use on the farm.

loans.use: Purchase three oxen for use on the farm

loans.name: Mr. Leay Soun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Krang Thmei village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Leay S. is the 66- year-old village bank president. He and his wife, Mrs. Vang Mao, are farmers who own 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest rice. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Leay S. decided to request a loan for this purpose. He is the father of two children, one of whom is a laborer in the hospital while the other is employed in a garment factory.  

One member of this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To request a loan to hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Mactar

texts.fr: agé de 31 ans ,mouhamadou a apres les études primaires appris le metier de tailleur pour avoir une qualification professionnelle.Depuis 5 ans il gere son propre  atelier avec trois modestes machines à coudre qui ne luipermet plus de repondre aux exigences de la clientelle . ansi il sollicite un pret pour l"acquisition d"une  nouvelle machine plus performante.
texts.en:
Following his primary schooling, 31 years old Mouhamadou, learned to be a tailor in order to have a professional qualification. For the last 5 years he has managed is own workshop with three basic sewing machines that no longer allow him to meet the demand of his customers. Thus, he is soliciting a loan to acquire a new, more efficient sewing machine.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina O. is 39 years old. She is married and has three children - one daughter and two sons. One of her sons is currently in the senior high school and the other is in the junior high school. Her daughter is in primary school. Faustina’s husband is a poultry farmer. Faustina also works to make some income to support her family. She and her family live in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Faustina sells poultry feed. She procures the feed from big poultry feed dealers in Tema in the Greater Accra Region of Ghana. She sells it to poultry farmers in her community. Faustina has a storehouse where she stores and sells her goods. She has been in business for ten years. Faustina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure poultry feed in bulk.

loans.use: To procure poultry feed

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: A sus 35 años, Roxana ha sabido ganarse la vida por sí sola, tiene una casa propia, la cual está hecha de material noble, se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Cocinando sus ricas salchipapas (platillo hecho a base de salchichas en rodajas y papas fritas) y hamburguesas, Roxana pasa sus días. Disfruta mucho de cocinar y lo hace con mucha habilidad, su comida es comprada por muchos clientes, los cuales acaban con la deliciosa comida en unos segundos. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una restaurante, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad la comida que prepara, porque actualmente solo lo hace por las noches, aunque tiene 3 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene, con todo el esfuerzo que realiza espera poder salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con trescientos nuevos soles que solicita planea comprar más ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platillos, con el resto del dinero comprará mesas y sillas para amoblar el restaurante que tanto desea tener.
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Roxana has known how to earn her way through life for herself; she has her own home, which is well-built, and she works hard to move forward and improve her quality of life. She works each day cooking delicious salchipapas (a dish made from sliced hot dogs and french fries) and hamburgers. She enjoys her job and she is a very skilled cook. She has many customers that purchase her food and who often buy seconds. In the future, she hopes to open a restaurant where she can sell the food she prepares all day and with greater ease as she currently only sells at night. Though she has run her business for 3 years, it is still difficult for her to attend to all her customers; yet she hopes to put forth greater effort to move forward and improve her life. This is her 5th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she is saving to pay her installments on time, since she hopes to avoid causing problems for the other members of her village bank where she feels very content. With the money she is requesting, she plans to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes; with the rest of the money she will buy tables and chairs to furnish the restaurant that she wishes to start.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Mrs. Savina P. ventured into the “sari-sari” (general store) business in order to help her husband. She is married and lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 5 children. Her husband is a laborer.

Mrs. P. got additional working capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in November, 2008. She is a Member in Good Standing of the Cooperative. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC because she has been able to continue her business and send her children to school. Today, she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her store. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром уже несколько лет в сфере бизнеса. Раньше он занимался куплей продажей сухофруктов. Постепенно накопив денег он открыл свою мини столовую (так как он имеет также профессию повара), которая расположена в центральном рынке. Здесь у него имеются постоянные клиенты, которые торгуют на рынке. Кроме блюд, которые предлагаются у него в столовой, он также привозит различные кондитерские изделия: булочки, торты, пирожные, пряники и тп. Многие его клиенты кроме горячих блюд заказывают в качестве десерта эти кондитерские изделия. 
Бахрому исполнилось 38 лет, женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена его сидит дома и воспитывает ребенка. Дополнительно к своему основному бизнесу Бахром занимается откормом скота и в этом ему помогает его жена. Для этой цели год назад Бахром стал кредитоваться  МикроИнвест и показал себя ответственным и пунктуальным клиентом. Сейчас он подал заявку на займ и собирается приобрести одного бычка и немного корма для него.
texts.en:
Bahrom has been working in the business sphere for several years. He used to sell dried fruit but, having gradually saved money, he opened a mini-canteen, located at the central market. Bahrom is also a cook by training. He has regular customers among the local vendors. In addition to the dishes offered in his canteen, Bahrom sells pastry: buns, cakes, ginger cookies, etc. Many of his clients, in addition to hot dishes, order dessert. Bahrom is 38 years old and is married with one child. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Besides his main business, with the help of his wife Bahrom raises cattle. A year ago Bahrom got a Microinvest loan for this purpose, and got a reputation of a responsible and punctual client. He has recently submitted an application for another loan, which he is going to use for the purchase of a bull calf and fodder.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and fodder

loans.name: Nak Bakat Group

texts.en:
Nak Bakat is the group leader of Nak Bakat group. There are three members in this group and they together want to take a loan of 42,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months for the progress of their businesses.

Nak Bakat wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Amana wants to take a loan for her leather-working business.

Raza Gul wants to take a loan for her mobile-selling-cart business.

So they are very happy with this process of loans that can support all people.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.en: Ismaila K. is 43 years old and married with five children. He makes and sells baking pans of various sizes and shapes. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more materials in order to make more baking pans. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more baking pans

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gloria runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 48 años, es soltera, vive con su hijo Arnold de 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tienda que instaló en su casa, donde ofrece gran cantidad y variedad de productos para la clientela asidua a su tienda. Maria se distrae mucho con su trabajo, ya que mientras vende su mercadería conversa con sus clientes, siendo una persona muy carismática. Pero no todo es fácil, ya que a veces le resulta muy cansado tener que permanecer durante todo el día atendiendo, pues abre desde las 6 de la mañana y se queda aproximadamente hasta las 9 de la noche porque siempre tiene clientes en ese horario. Para un futuro cercano, a Maria le gustaría implementar su tienda colocando un mostrador con otros artículos no comestibles, teniendo así un mini bazar. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy responsable con todos sus pagos al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita empezará a comprar aquellos productos no comestibles para ir implementando su bazar y sus clientes no tendrán que ir más lejos de su vecindario en busca de estos artículos.
texts.en:
48-year old Maria is single and lives with her 14-year old son Arnold in their own home. For the last three years she has earned her living by selling groceries from the store located in her house. She offers a wide variety of products to her many regular customers. Maria enjoys her work very much as while she sells her merchandise, she chats to the customers—she is a very charismatic person. But it isn’t an easy life. Sometimes she gets very tired as she has to work the whole day long serving customers; she opens up at 6am and remains in the store until up to 9 pm at night as there are often customers at that time. In the near future, Maria would like to equip her store with a counter displaying non-grocery items, like a mini hardware store. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has always been a responsible person with her repayments—just like everyone else in her group. With the money she will start to buy products to stock her hardware store so that her customers won’t have to go out of the neighbourhood to buy these items.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hardware items

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Шабнам Косимова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 24 года. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж работает в строительной компании Российской  Федерации. Шабнам сама более 4 лет занимается выращивает овощей. У нее имеются постоянные покупатели. Кредит просит посева урожая, т.е. покупки минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Shabnam K. lives in the Gissar district. She is 24 years old, married and has 1 child. Her husband works at a construction company in the Russian Federation. Shabnam has been growing vegetables for over 4 years. She has loyal customers. She is requesting a loan for planting the crop, i.e. purchasing mineral fertilizers and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For planting crops

loans.name: Once Por Ciento Group

texts.es: Banco D. Emprendimiento: ONCE POR CIENTO fue fundado el 29 D. julio D. 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir.Está compuesto por 11 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: Rosmery V. F., se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos mediante revista Avon y Yambal, es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Tesorera: Maria Gumercinda Z. es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento Once Porciento, se dedica al rubro D. venta D. perfumes y cosmeticos D. Yanbal y Esika, ademas D. trabajar como empleada D. limpieza, dentro del rubro tiene 9 años D. antiguedad y tambien realiza labores D. casa. Con los ingresos que persibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, tiene 4 hijos,es viuda por eso es que ella trabaja incansablemente, las socias del grupo la consideran un ejemplo. Secretaria:Yoissy G. C., se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo, perfumes y cosmeticos,tiene 23 años D. edad, y 5 años D. antigüedad en el rubro, trabaja D. lunes a viernes 6 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su domicilio y a las personas que ella visita para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Incremento de Capitales de Trabajo y Mercaderia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Khajak

texts.en: Khajak is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a mini-market since 2006 to earn income to help satisfy, in collaboration with his parents, the needs of the family. Today, Khajak is applying for a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a laptop for the accounting and the inventory of his shop in order to develop his work.

loans.use: purchase a laptop

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a native cake vendor in their village.  She is 52 years and still aiming for a success in life. She  is living with her family in the village of Sta. Rosa, Santiago City, Isabela. She both stand as father and mother to her four children. She is happy because she is able to provide all the needs of her family. Her four children are already married.

Anita would like to buy additional native cakes so that she could generate bigger income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP5,000 that will be a great help in improving her vending business.  She is hoping that the loan amount she is requesting will be granted. Anita is hoping that she could improve her way of living.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Fredielyn

texts.en:
Fredielyn B. is from the village of Purok 4, Valencia City. She is 25 years old. Fredielyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Fredielyn owns & operates a business providing internet services to local community members. Fredielyn has been engaged in her internet cafe business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fredielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fredielyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fredielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Chhom C., age 34, is married and has three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. To make a living, she designs and sews clothing. She earns an income of US $4.00 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband, a taxi driver in Kampot Province, who earns US $4.50 per day as the primary source of income for the family. C. and her husband are seeking to improve his business and their family's standard of living. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old single mother of two teenage boys. She has run the Brown Skin Beauty Clinic since 2004 in the Kayole area of Nairobi. She offers manicures, pedicures, and hairdressing for men and women.  Beatrice employs one person and she describes herself as very successful.

Beatrice has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 through Kiva's field partner, Faulu, to add stock to the salon.

Beatrice says that she has developed her business from very humble beginnings.  She dreams of expanding into more businesses in the future.

loans.use: Purchase stock for beauty salon

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn P. lives in Sitio Tuburan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 37 years old and married to Pelagio, who is a farmer. They have three children between the ages of 12 and 19. Two of them are still attending school and one is working in Manila, the capital city of the Philippines, and helps her parents support their family by sending money every month. Jonalyn wants her children to finish their studies, and she wants to help her husband earn income for their family.
 
To help her husband earn a living for the family, she put up a small general store adjacent to their house. At the start, her earnings were small, but it helped support their household expenses, and she saw that it had potential for expansion if she only had the necessary capital to fill her store with products to sell. This is why she joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1988, and with the additional capital from her loans, she is now able to earn a monthly income of about $213 a month, most of which she spends for their household expenses. She is also saving up for the education of her children. 

Now she is in her 18th loan cycle, borrowing 27,000 PHP as additional working capital for her general store.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: Damaris del Carmen E. M. de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, vive junto a  sus tres hijos menores de edad. Damaris posee una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así también vende vaselinas, la cuales son un tipo de crema para la piel. Cada día Damaris sale a las calles de Ciudad delgado ofreciendo su producto de manera ambulante, lo cual le deja ganancias diarias, la cuales no le son suficiente para solventar todos sus gastos familiares, ya que ella debe esforzarse el doble por su familia debido a que es madre soltera. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales muchas personas se los solicitan y que por falta de capital no ha podido comprar, ella espera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
33-year-old Damaris del Carmen E. M. lives in Ciudad Delgado with her three children who are minors. Damaris sells clothing for men, women and children and also sells petroleum jelly, which is a type of skin cream. Every day, Darmaris takes to the streets of Ciudad Delgado to sell her product on foot. Her daily income is not enough to cover all of her living expenses because she has to work doubly hard for her family since she's a single mother. She is requesting a loan that she'll use to buy a greater amount of products, which many people are asking for and which she has not been able to buy due to a lack of capital. She hopes to improve her business conditions and to be able to increase her daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy skin products.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 43, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business where she makes and sell snacks in the market. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en: Born in 1980, N. Saifullo is married and has one child. He is a farmer and agriculture has become his beloved job, and has been the principle source of income for him for the last ten years. On his land he produces different kinds of produce. Thanks to his experiences that he gained during ten years, he gets a rich harvest every year from his land. In light of the current high demand, Saifullo would like to improve his land and production to meet the market. In order to do this, he is seeking a loan of 8,000 Somoni to buy fuels and lubricants and fertilizer for improving and expanding his harvest. He would then be able to better take care of his family's health and food needs. You could become an important part of the life of Saifullo’s family. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden A. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts paste and charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Kiden is 39 years old and is married to a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: S. Christine est née le 5 mars 1962 à Zè. Mariée à DAGNIHOUN Parfait, un enseignant, elle habite au quartier Gbégamey à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Christine est mère d’un enfant et a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Christine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours primaire. Il y a dix ans, Christine s’est mise dans la vente de mèches, produits de beauté, et de fagots de bois au marché de Allada. Christine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l’institution. Christine a bien remboursé les trois crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. Christine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’accroître son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Christine S. was born on 5th March 1962 in Zé. Married to Parfait DAGMIHOUN, a teacher, she lives in the Gbégamey district of Allada, a town in the "département" (administrative division) of Atlantique. Christine has one child of her own and two others in her care. All the children are at school. Christine lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Christine went to school up until primary level. Ten years ago she started selling hairpieces, beauty products and bundles of firewood at the market in Allada. Christine is an old client of ALIDé, having already benefited from three loans from the company. She has repaid all three loans without incident. She is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to satisfy better customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairpieces and beauty products

loans.name: Aeth

texts.en: Mrs. Aeth U. is 48 years old and a villager who lives in Trapeang Snao village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living for her family. Her husband, Mr. Koa Kem, is a construction worker who can make a small salary to support his family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to improve their family's living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Aeth U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions.  Mrs. Aeth U. is a mother of three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel Ángel N. de 24 años de edad trabaja como comerciante revendedo, se dedica a la compra y venta de mercaderías varias. El mismo trabaja con sus hermanos, Norma N. de Peralta de casa san Miguel y  el señor Papi N. de comercial Katia quienes le dan su vehiculo para la venta de los productos ya sobre pedidos.

El mismo recorre la zona de Independencia para las solicitudes de pedidos para luego llevar los productos sobre pedidos.

El señor Miguel solicita un crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya para capital operativo(compra de calzados deportivos, sabanas, ropas de todo tipo, lencerias) dicho préstamo al retirarse agradeció por darle la confianza y el buen servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Ángel N. is 24 years old and works as a resale vendor, he sells and purchases various goods. He works with his brothers Norma N. de Peralta de casa san Miguel and Mr. Papi N. of the store Katia, who give him a vehicle to sell products already on order. He also covers the Independence zone for order requests in order to later carry the products on order. Mr. Miguel requests a loan at the Foundation Paraguaya for working capital (purchase of athletic shoes, sheets, all types of clothing, lingerie), the loan will be withdrawn thanks to the trust and good service given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of athletic shoes, clothing of all types, sheets, towels, lingerie

loans.name: Tabitha Juma

texts.en:
Tabitha Juma R. is 48 years old, married to Charles Olale, and they have four children. They live in the Oruba area in Migori town. 

Tabitha sells second-hand clothes in Migori market and has been in this business for the last 12 years. This will be the seventh loan that she has had from KADET. She intends to use the money to increase the stock in her business which includes men’s shirts and children’s clothes. Her clients are mainly people who come to shop at the market.

Her hope is to improve her business and even invest in other fields.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more salon materials to boost her business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene 7 hijos. Reside en la comunidad de Palestina Alta, ubicada en la majestuosa selva Cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia. Félix se considera un hombre luchador y audaz, posee terrenos agrícolas en donde cultiva café y cacao. Usualmente trabaja con sus peones en tiempos de siembra y cosecha, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Es así que lleva 43 años trabajando duro y parejo, desde las 7:00AM hasta las 6:00 PM y por lo general sus productos son vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad a precio de mercado, eso le favorece mucho en su economía. Su mayor anhelo es adquirir más terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de aumentar su volumen de ventas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete  a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además está contento con su grupo comunal, por las ventajas que otorgan. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en darle un tratamiento continuo a sus terrenos de cultivo, comprando insumos y abonos.
texts.en:
Félix is 56 years old, married, and has seven children. He resides in the community of Palestina Alta, located in the majestic Cuscan jungle, where he has his own home. Félix is regarded as a determined and bold gentleman who possesses farmland on which he grows coffee and cacao. He usually hires workers during the planting and harvesting seasons, but on occasion he receives assistance from his family. Félix has worked long and hard for the past 43 years, from 7am to 6pm. His products are generally sold to the collection centers in his community at market price, which is in his favor financially. In hopes of increasing his sales, Félix indicates that his greatest wish is to acquire more farmland.

This is his third loan with MFP. Félix commits to completing his loan obligations. He is also happy with his Communal Bank and the benefits that come with being a member. The loan he requested will be used to purchase supplies and compost so that he can continue to provide treatment to his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & farming supplies

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Ramón lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la comarca San Ramón, Tisma municipio de Masaya. Las actividades más fuertes de la región son la ganadería y agricultura.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora  Maryuri M. quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y la producción de alimentos tradicionales a base de la carne de cerdo como el nacatamal, frito y chicharrón. Esta actividad la realiza cada ocho días con el préstamo piensa aumentar la producción con la compra de mayor cantidad de cerdos.

Sus compañeras de grupo karla P. D. quien vende verdura, prendas de oro y plata y comida como vigoron, enchiladas, chanfaina, sopas de mondongo activida que aprendo a la edad de seis años mientras le ayudaba a su madre y Maricela CU. P. desde hace tres años vende ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The San Ramón group is made up of three strong, hard-working women who are from the region of San Ramón, the town of Masaya. The principle economic activities of this area are raising animals and farming. The coordinator of the group is Mrs Maryuri M. who works cutting up pork and making traditional Nicaraguan foods with the pork, such as nacatamales (fried filled corn cakes) and chicharrón (fried pork skins). She does this every week and with the loan, plans on buying more pigs so that she can increase her production Another member of the group is Karla P. D., who sells vegetables, gold and silver jewelry, and food such as vigoron (dish made with yucca, pork rinds, and cabbage) enchiladas (tortillas baked with other ingredients), chanfaina (a stew made with pig innards), and mondongo (tripe) soup. She learned to make these foods when she was six by helping her mother. Another member is Maricela CU. P. who has been selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics for the last three years.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pigs

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr:
N. Albert est née dans le capital du BURUNDI (Bujumbura) dans un district de Kibitoki, il était  au Burundi comme refugié Rwandais, il est rentré dans son pays d'origine en 1995 après le génocide perpétré contre les Tutsi de 1994 .Il est célibataire, âgée de 28 ans, son niveau d’étude est six ans de primaire (6ans).

Il exerce son business dans le centre ville de NYAMATA, comme commerçant de détail en boutique, sa résidence est un peu rurale, il exerce les activités d’agriculture (il cultive les sorghos, haricots et maniocs) pouvant lui aider dans la vie quotidienne de sa famille.

C’est son premier  prêt contracté auprès d’ACB et avec ce prêt, il a acheté  des articles pour ravitailler son business avec lequel il compte devenir riche. Pour acheter la farine de maïs, du sucre , des savons, boissons limonades (Fanta) pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et continuer a aller de l’avant surtout économiquement. Comme il le dit, ses ambitions sont de mieux rembourser son prêt pour que la Banque lui accorde un prêt d’un gros montant pour acheter les articles important, afin d’agrandir les profits de ses activités ainsi devenir un grand commerçant.

Dans l’avenir, il compte à améliorer ses activités en augmentant la quantité de ces produits et améliorer ses conditions de vie. A part ça, il compte se marier et avoir des enfants et un bon foyer dans le futur pour reconstruire son pays.
texts.en:
N. Albert was born in the capital of BURUNDI (Bujumbura) in the district of Kibitoki. He was in Burundi as a Rwandan refugee, and he returned to his country of origin in 1995, after the genocide perpetrated against the Tutsi in 1994. He is 28, single, and managed to finish 6 years of primary school. He does business in the center of the town of NYAMATA, as a retailer with a little shop. His home is somewhat rural, so he also plants sorghum, beans, and manioc for his family's day-to-day consumption. This is his first loan with ACB, and he used it to buy inventory for his business, with which he hopes to become rich. This loan of 500,000 Rwandan francs served to buy maize flour, sugar, soap, and sodas (Fanta) so that he can increase his turnover and continue to make progress, especially economically speaking. He says that his ambition is to reimburse his loan well so that the Bank will accord him a larger amount and he can buy a lot of items so as to increase the profit from his business and become a wholesaler. In the future he intends to improve his business by buying more products and improve his living conditions. Apart from that, he intends to have a wife and children and a good household later on so as to reconstruct his country.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of soap, maize flour, and beans to stock his shop better

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy N. S. is married with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's  basic needs. Dorothy has been operating her retail shop for the last five years.She sells retail to her local customers. Her other sources of income are from rental houses and the selling of firewood. Dorothy faces major challenges of theft and high transport costs. She owns a home with no electricity or piped water. She would like to save enough money to allow her children have a good education. To do that Dorothy is asking for a loan of Kshs 60,000 to start a motorcycle business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: La señora azucena tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y tambien  vende ropa usada los fines de semana, la señora tiene a su cargo a tres nietas y las ah sacado adelante y les a dado educación. Sus nietas le ayudan en la tienda de abarrotes cuando ella se tiene que ir a trabajar en la venta de ropa usada. La señora azucena es una mujer muy trabajadora y para mejorar sus ventas necesita reparar el techo de donde ella guarda la ropa que vende, ya que el techo esta muy deteriorado por  las lluevias.
texts.en:
Ms. Azucena runs a small grocery store and also sells second hand clothing. She has three granddaughters whom she cares for and whom she has moved ahead and educated. Her granddaughters help her in the grocery store when she has to leave to sell clothing. Ms. Azucena is a hard working woman and needs to repair the roof over the area where she stores the clothing that she sells. The roof is in very bad shape because of the rains.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom T. is 24 years old and a married mother who cares for two children who are pupils in the local public school. Prom T. is a rattan cupboard seller. Since 2008, she and her husband have owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. In addition to their daily income, the couple also orders a variety of other miscellaneous crops to store for a while before selling to make a profit. Prom T. will use this loan to purchase rice and green beans for resale. The loan will provide her with additional revenue, which she will use to ensure that her family has a decent standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice and green beans for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Mariam has a business selling vegetables, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Mariam hopes to go back to school. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her learn how not to be selfish with others. 


Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 29 años es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 36 años y sus dos queridos hijos Jayer de 8 y Ángel de 4 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. A través de estos años Gladys ha trabajado muy duro para que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad, todas las mañanas con la ayuda de su esposo, trabaja sus tierras, para que sean mas productivas. La papa y arveja que cultiva, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde le ofrecen mejores precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los mercados donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poder sembrar todas sus tierras, para poder incrementar su producción. Es el primer crédito con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyan y guían sus compañeras del grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old. She is a very unpretentious and happy person. She lives in her own home together with her husband Jose, 36 years old, and their two beloved children, Jayer, 8 years old, and Angel, 4 years old. They are the driving force behind all her efforts. Over the years Gladys has worked very hard in her plantations to yield high quality harvests. Every morning she and her husband work the fields so make them more productive. The potato and sweet pea harvests are sold in the city of Tarma, location where she gets the best prices. What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest. She has 10 years' experience in the field. The most difficult part of the work is having to transport the harvest to the markets where it will be sold. In time she hopes to cultivate the entire expanse of her fields to increase production. This loan is the first she requests through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the responsibilities of the loan. She wishes to acquire future loans to keep developing her business. She knows that the community bank will support her and guide her along with the other colleagues of her group. With the thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests she will purchase fertilizer to achieve a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 29, is married with one young child living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. (Sok S. and her husband were not available so their father is pictured instead.) She works in the garment factory, typically making $2 US each day; her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes about $2.50 each day. However, this couple need to take care their old father. Sok S. would like a loan of $1000 to make two investments. First, create a new business selling fruits and second, is used to build a house.

loans.use: Sell fruits and build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. After her first child was born, she decided to help her husband with the household and  baby expenses, so she started working as a private teacher in her home. To receive the students, she has prepared a special education room.  

Today, she is requesting a loan of $500 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform modifications needed for the room. She needs to add more tables, a bigger wall and education tools in order to be able to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to perform modifications needed for the education room

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y la menor D. sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace más D. 8 años que tiene una ferretería, instalada en su misma casa, ya que contaba con un espacio amplio dentro del inmueble que pudo acondicionar para llevar a cabo éste negocio, considerando además que se encuentra ubicada en una zona céntrica. D. esta manera su ferretería cuenta con todo tipo D. materiales D. construcción, en el que fácilmente son almacenados en su casa, para no tener contratiempos al momento que el cliente requiera cierto producto. Su esposo es su principal apoyo que recibe, considera que este negocio le es rentable porque los clientes siempre solicitan D. sus productos, por tal motivo desea incrementar D. más mercadería en su ferretería. Este es su crédito número 23 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias, asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras D. este préstamo que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor D. tuberías para instalaciones eléctricas y D. agua potable.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her four children in their own house.  

For more than 8 years, she has owned a hardware store.  It is located in her home, because it has a large space insiD. that she could set up as the business and it is in a central location.  Her hardware store has all types of building materials, which are easily stored in her home, in case a customer needs a certain product at any time.  Her husband is her main source of support.  Her business is profitable because the customers always ask for their products, and for this reason, they want to proviD. more merchandise in the hardware store.

This is their 23rd loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support and that she is known as a responsible person with her payments.  She is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very caring people.  She also thanks all of the people who contribute to this loan, that will be very useful to the progress of her business.

With this loan, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of tubes for electrical installations and for drinking water.

loans.use: Purchase tubes for electric wiring installations and drinking water

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité MANKO est créé le 28 mars 2007. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de THIECKENE-LOUGA

Madame PENDA S. à droite de la photo, en écharpe bleue foncée, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine comme activité principale. Et parallèlement elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide.

Avec son nouveau elle va acheter un bélier et des arachides pour mener ses activités.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Manko Solidarity group was created on 28 March 2007. It is composed of 6 women, all of whom come from the same village. They formed their group through familial and local relations. The group is a member of the Village Loan fund of Thieckene-Louga.

Ms. Penda S., in the dark blue scarf on the right side of the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children.

Her main activity is sheep-rearing. On the side, she also processes and sells peanut oil.

With this new loan, she is going to buy a ram and peanuts for her business.

Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy and raise sheep

loans.name: Edgar Wilber

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; El socio tiene 51 años de edad, el es soltero; el socio tiene una peluquería el trabaja en su salón de belleza como estilista profesional, el socio conoce muy todo este mercado de la belleza y se ha especializado en maquillaje y cortes y peinados. El socio desea comprar productos de belleza como son tintes, peines, líquidos para ondulaciones y algunas tijeras. El socio desea invertir el capital en la compra de productos de belleza. 

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edgar, 51, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single and has a barber shop.  He works in his beauty salon as a professional stylist.  He knows the beauty market very well and has specialized in make-up, haircuts and hair styling.  He wants to buy beauty products like hair dyes, combs, waving liquids and some scissors.  He wants to invest the capital purchasing beauty products.

He is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 39 year old man. He is married and a father to three. He sells suitcases and bags in a busy area in Nairobi where the population is very high and he employs one person. He is requesting a loan of 65,000 Kes to add to his stock of suitcases and bags. 

He is a member of "Forty in One" SHG and the group has guaranteed the loan. He hopes to venture in the transport industry in the future with a five year plan of buying a taxi and purchasing a plot of land. He describes himself as stable.

loans.use: To add to his stock of suitcases and bags

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Marilyn is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 31-year-old married woman, the mother of three children and owner of a grocery store since 2000. Lina is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her goods and add new items to her shop. This is an important source of livelihood for Lina’s family since she supports her husband in their social and financial lives. Lina works hard at customer service because she believes clients are her treasure to handle more in the future. She hopes to expand her business and improve its decor.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Sorie K.

texts.en: Pictured here is Sorie K. M..  The forty-four-year-old was born in Kabala town; he has four children; his wife is businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Sorie has been selling spare-parts such as tyres, inner tubes, driving chairs, etc. and house building materials such as nails.  Sorie is seeking for a loan of SLL 5,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: Buys tyres, inner tubes, driving chairs, nails, etc.

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Odette N. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Elle est veuve, née au Congo (RDC), et elle a 8 enfants entre 12 ans et 28 ans, et 3 personnes en charge.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école, et elle a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’une grande quantité de pommes de terre, et pour acheter d’électricité pour son deuxième business d’électricité.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter  son business, est aller à l’extérieur du pays pour amener une grande quantité des pommes de terre pour les vendre au marché.  Elle voudrait augmenter la quantité vendue de pommes de terre, avoir un bon foyer, et satisfaire les besoins de son foyer.  Elle voudrait aussi éduquer ses enfants jusqu'à l’université.
texts.en:
Odette N., a merchant, has been a member of ACB since 2009. Born in the Congo (DRC), she is a widow with eight children whose ages range between 12 and 28. She also has three other people in her care. She completed six years of primary school, and two of her children go to school. 

She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of potatoes and to get electricity for her second business. Her growth strategy is to bolster her activities by travelling abroad to acquire large quantities of potatoes for sale at the market. She wants to increase her sales of potatoes, keep a good home, and meet the needs of her household. She also wants her children to pursue university studies.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, electricity for sale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 46 years old, is a married woman from the town of Surallah. She has 2 children aged 18 and 13. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Aida also helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Aida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Aida is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Margaret Charo

texts.en:
Margaret Charo T. is a 31-year old lady  She is married to Charo, and they have two children.  Margaret runs a retail shop and she has been in this business for the last six years. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.   She plans to purchase cooking oil, flour, maize meal and soft drinks for sale. She will use the anticipated profits  to support and increase the business, as she hopes to grow it and be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, flour, maize meal and soft drinks

loans.name: Ann Wanjiru

texts.en:
Ann  Wanjiru M. is 38 years old and a single mother of two children, Allan aged 15 years, and Maxwell, aged 7 years, who are both in primary school. 

She runs a green grocery shop located in Kitengela market, which is a busy market. Her business of three years gives her a monthly profit of KES 23,000. 

Ann was introduced to KADET Ltd. by an existing customer, and this will be her first loan from KADET. She plans to use this loan amount to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits and transport them from upcountry farms to town where she can sell them at a profit.

In the future, she wishes to open a big store and start supplying vegetables to schools. Ann describes herself as focused and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase and transport more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en: Liberatha is 53 years old and a mother of 4 children who are between the ages of 13 to 30. Liberata makes and sells a banana juice called ‘Imitobe’; she is requesting a loan to invest in this juice business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for their juice

loans.name: Ylaria

texts.es: Ylaria tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fernando de 29 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Gabriel de 08 años y paúl de 03 años de edad, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su querido pueblo de Santa Rosa, Ylaria ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad agrícola, hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras al lado de su esposo donde juntos cultivan cacao, café y hojas de coca, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para cubrir la necesidades de sus hijos. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde percibe mejores precios por cada uno de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 09 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción de cacao y café.
texts.en: Ylaria is 28 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman, who lives in her own house together with her husband Fernando, age 29, and their 2 beloved children, Gabriel, age 8, and Paúl, age 3, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Ylaria has spent the greater part of her life in her beloved village of Santa Rosa. Since she was a very young girl, she has learned how to farm; today she works on her own fields at her husband's side, where together they grow cacao, coffee and coca leaves. This work has provided the income necessary to cover the needs of her children. She sells everything she harvests to the wholesale centers located in the city of San Francisco, where she receives better prices for each of her products. What she likes most about her work is planting her fields, and she does this with great care. She has done this work for 9 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is transporting her products, since cargo vehicles are very scarce in this part of the rainforest zone of the Apurimac river valley. With time, she would like to buy new lands, with the aim of increasing her production. This is her fifth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual with her previous loans and she plans to continue in the same way. In her communal bank, she is very active and very well-liked by the rest of the members. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy compost and fertilizers to improve her cacao and coffee production.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old and widowed, with one child.  Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from decorations sales.  Carmelita aspires to build and expand her business to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Susy

texts.es:
La Sra. Susy C. A. es comerciante individual y cuenta con un salón de Belleza que opera bajo el nombre de "Dalias", Susy antes de contar con su propio negocio, trabajaba en un salón de belleza lo que le permito adquirir muy buena experiencia y clientela misma una vez instalando su negocio comenzó a visitarle, sus clientes se sienten muy satisfechos por el servicio que les brinda ya que los atiende con profesionalismo y los productos que se les aplica son de líneas de belleza muy reconocidas.     
Susy utilizara el credito para la compra de productos varios y así surtir para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable y expresa sentirse feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien.
texts.en:
Ms. Susy C. Alvaregna is a small business owner who runs a beauty salon called "Dalias." Before starting her own business, Susy used to work in a beauty salon, which allowed her to gain lots of experience and build her clientele. Once she set up her own salon, these customers started to frequent it. They are very satisfied with the services that she provides because she attends to them with professionalism, and she uses well-known products.

Susy will use this loan in order to purchase various products so that she can restock her business and meet customer demand.

Her business has grown noticeably, and she feels happy because everything is coming out well.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye, shavers, shampoo, conditioner, scissors, nail polish, towels, lotions, and oils.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 35, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Nary sells groceries and is a cleaner for a private company, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 83 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Nary is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a stand at the market to start a new business by selling groceries. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a stand at the market to sell groceries

loans.name: Masika

texts.fr: La cliente Masika est entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, veuve, mère de 4 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des oignons, ails, etc. Elle s’installe dans un dépôt de vente au centre commercial agricole de Birere. Il ya 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  20 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  10 sacs d’oignons, 12 sacs d’ails et le reste sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une grande parcelle pour sa famille enfin d’y construire aisément.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The customer, Masika, is an entrepreneur, who is 48 years old, a widow and mother to four children, all of whom are studying. She sells onions, garlic, etc. She has set herself up in a sales outlet at the agricultural shopping centre in Birere. She has been carrying out this activity for the past 15 years. She has, however, just completed her 20th loan cycle with Hekima. This new loan will be used to get fresh supplies: ten sacks of onions and 12 sacks of garlic; the remainder will be used for small family projects. Furthermore, her ambition is to be able to educate her children and buy a large piece of land for her family in order to build a house with ease. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favour of poor women who are unable to access classic banks.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of onions and twelve sacks of garlic, etc

loans.name: Nyamwegabirwa Twetungure Group

texts.en: Ruth, aged 49 years, is one hardworking lady who is very partial to the philosophy of thinking outside the box. The happily married mother of four banked on her creative ideas to set forth in her retail business a decade ago in Kihihi. Back then, Ruth used to cherish the phrase "Nothing ventured, nothing gained". It was her courage of conviction and tempting fate attitude that was behind the decision to try this business. Through the 10 years, Ruth has learned the tricks and nitty gritty of retail trading. It is the sole reason she says why her business is still carving out a stronger niche. Ruth says she used her savings to get established. She is a primary school teacher in her home area. She says this business generates her 90,000 shillings sale profits weekly. The purpose of this loan she says is to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Maricel has a food shop that sells rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. Maricel has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make rice cakes.
Maricel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make rice cakes

loans.name: Angel Leonidas

texts.es: El sr. Ángel, es un cliente nuevo, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la atención de eventos, animación de fiestas, cumpleaños, promociones, prestes y   matrimonios. El sr. Ángel, vive en la avenida zona villa armonía, Por lo que se ha podido ver, es un cliente joven emprendedor, que trabaja con su familia y con el tiempo piensa expandir mas su negocio, y trasladarlo a un lugar mas comercial para lo cual  esta poniendo empeño a sus actividades, con mucho entusiasmo en cuanto a la ampliación de su negocio por lo cual esta solicitando  crédito, para la compra de luces inteligentes y así subir la calidad de su sistema de amplificación.
texts.en:
Sr. Ángel is a new client and has good credit references. He is an event organizer for celebrations, birthdays, promotions, and weddings. He lives on Zona Avenue in Villa Armonía. It is clear that he is an enterprising young man who works with his family. As time goes on, he plans to expand his business and move to a more commercial space. For that reason he is putting a lot of enthusiastic effort into his work.

Ángel is seeking a loan to buy a laser light system and thus improve the quality of his amplifying system.

loans.use: to buy a laser light system

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen was born in 1988. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a determined business lady who has been running a grocery shop since 2006 to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to be operating in a permanent stall so that her business can grow and to expand to other regions. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making loans accessible to her.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is a widow. She has two daughters who are garment workers. She lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phally is a corn farmer. Besides farming, she also sells mangoes. She hopes to continue her farming business, so she is asking for another loan of $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She will also use part of the loan to purchase additional corn on contract from her fellow villagers for sale.

Photo: Phally and her brother.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy additional corn on contract from her fellow villagers for sale.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: Euphrasie est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Isaïe. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Euphrasie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Euphrasie et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Euphrasie n'est pas allée à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Euphrasie vend divers produits à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Euphrasie vend des tissus et des chaussures.
