Con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. Vive en Anticrético en una casa ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado y tiene dos hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Carlos is a mechanic and also sells vehicle accessories.  He needs this loan to buy items such as windshield wipers and spare parts for engines since he has a lot of demand for them.  Carlos uses the income he makes to support himself.  He lives in a rental house, in Las Lomas neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has two children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy windshield wipers and spare parts for engines, for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose C. V. es vecino de Pérez Zeledón. El se dedica al engorde de cerdos desde hace poco tiempo.
Gracias a  a la idea de uno de sus amigos, don Jose será parte de un proyecto en su pueblo con el que formaran la porqueriza más grande de  la comunidad. Para ello el necesita un préstamo de  ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para pagar la mano de obra y parte del material necesario para construir la porqueriza.
El es  socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose C. V. lives in Pérez Zeledón and raises pigs.  He has only been in the business for a short period of time.

Thanks to a friend who came up with the idea, Jose will be part of a project in his village to set up the largest pig farm in the community.  He needs a loan of 594,000 CRC to pay for labor costs and part of the construction material for the pig pen.

He is a member of the "Productores El General" Association, one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce and Rick S. own Frosted Delights by Joyce, a café and bakery located in San Antonio’s “Southtown District” (just south of downtown).  They bake custom-order cakes for weddings and special events, as well as offering coffee, food, and desserts in their café.  A few weeks ago, Joyce and Rick expanded their menu to include deli food, giving customers dining options for any time of the day. 
 
Having baked recreationally for most of her life, Joyce dreamed of someday owning her own bakery.    Prior to opening “Frosted Delights by Joyce,” she spent twenty years working with AT&T.  Rick spent most of his life in the trucking industry and was working as an operations supervisor when the recession forced the company he was working for to eliminate his position.  Instead of looking for a new job in the trucking business, Rick, together with  Joyce, decided to retire from their careers and launch their own business.

Rick and Joyce opened “Frosted Delights by Joyce” in November, 2010.  In the six months they have been in business, they have already developed a loyal clientele.   For them, it is rewarding to see repeat customers walk through their doors because it tells them they are doing a good job.  They hope to continue growing the deli and delivery part of their business by capitalizing on their location close to downtown.  With all of the companies in the area, they see great opportunity for growth.

Rick says that he and Joyce work more hours now than they ever have, but that being personally and emotionally invested in the business makes it all worthwhile.  In addition to the two of them, Frosted Delights by Joyce has two part-time employees.  Joyce and Rick are using this loan to purchase more equipment.  For example, they need more baking pans, and as their business continues to grow, will soon need another oven.

loans.use: to buy equipment: baking pans, snow cone machine, oven.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 51-year-old man living in Bint Jbeil and father of two children. He has owned a bakery since 2000, with 10 years of experience. He is a hard worker. He has good reputation for his proficiency at work. His customers are the people living in his town. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy a silent generator to keep his bakery provided with the necessary electricity when it’s not provided by the government. He hopes to expand the bakery in the future and buy new equipments. He hopes to be the first in his domain and be well known for his good product quality. Ahmad also hopes he can educate his children to be important people in their community.

loans.use: To buy a silent generator necessary to provide his bakery with electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming supplies.

loans.name: Narankhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Narankhuu is a 53-year-old widow. She lives with her youngest son’s family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has four children; the three eldest ones are married and live with their families. She owns a small land plot and a house on it. Her youngest son, Batjargal, runs a small workshop to repair digital cameras. 

Mrs. Narankhuu has been on her pension since 2008. Last year, she started to renovate her house but could not finish it due to the coming wintertime and shortage of money. The loan she is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials to complete the unfinished renovation to her family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to complete the unfinished renovation to her family house.

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mrs. Oeur, 47, has been producing fish-paste for many years. She is a single mother who now lives in a small house with two single children: one works in the fishing business and the other one sells many kinds of goods at home.  She has three other children who are married and live in a separate house. Mrs. Oeur is seeking a loan from Kiva to use as capital to buy more fish to produce fish-paste for sale and to support her child in the merchandise business. Mrs. Oeur is pictured in front her daughter’s store.

loans.use: to buy more fish to produce fish-paste for sale and to support her child in the merchandise business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and married to Mbatha, and they are blessed with four children, aged 20, 16, 10 and 8. He has been operating his shoe business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 13,500 which he uses to take care of his family.

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This will be his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to purchase stock of shoes and clothes for sale.

He plans to use the profit from his business to buy a pick-up for transporting shoes to other towns and to open a wholesale shoe shop. In the future, he hopes to be a wholesale seller and to be importing shoes from abroad.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lydia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy piglets and feed.

Lydia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: To build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
Florencia tiene 53 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) pero ahora vive en la comunidad de Papel Pata a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). Desde muy joven se dedico a la agricultura, ella cultiva frutas, cacao, café y los distribuye en la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ya son varios años que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas y para plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convención province and an important commerce center in the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main economic activity is production of coca, coffee, cacao, and fruit.

Florencia is 53-years-old and has two children.  She was born in Cusco (Peru), but no now lives in the community called Papel Pata 45 minutes away from the city of Quillabamba (La Convención, Cusco).

Since she was very young she has worked in agriculture.  She grows fruit, cacao, and coffee and distributes them in the city of Quillabamba.  She has been in this business for several years and it has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time she needs the loan to buy fruit and for cacao plantations.

loans.use: to buy fruit and for cacao plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another barber shop and buy a shaving machine, chairs and mirrors.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata de 48 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alejandro de 54 años y sus 03 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Honorata trabaja todos los días en sus tierras. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, pues ahí  siembra de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plantas de cacao y café ya que estos son los productos que mejor precio tiene en los mercados.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectarlas, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Ya que las plagas aquejan sus sembríos, Honorata comprará con el crédito solicitado tramperas para combatir  los insectos quienes se apoderan de los frutos de las plantas. Para el bien de su futuro espera  cuidar con el mismo ímpetu sus parcelas. Este será su 17avo crédito de Honorata con MFP,  por tanto espera de un pequeño apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo su propósito y por ello esta apta en devolver todo sus aportes puntualmente como en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto  de las socias. Con los 2,000 mil nuevos soles, comprará mallas que utilizará como trampas, para combatir con la plaga de insectos que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Honorata, 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Alejandro, 54, and their three minor children for whom they want to provide the best quality of life.  Together with her husband, Honorata works every day on her land.  With much effort she has been able to make her land more productive.  She grows a little bit of everything and produces quality crops, the mains ones being cocoa and coffee since these command the highest price at market.

What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops against insect plagues since this would reduce profits.  She has been in this trade for 20 years and feels the hardest part of it is transporting the crops to the city of San Francisco which is where she sells them.  Since plagues are a menace to the crops, Honorata will use the loan to buy wire netting to combat the insects.  She plans to care for all of her cropland in the same way to protect her future.  This is her 17th loan through MFP and she is counting on lenders to help her meet her goal.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She is a very supportive member of her communal bank.  With this 2,000 PEN loan she will buy wire netting to combat the insect plagues threatening her crops.

loans.use: To buy several meters of wire netting.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 42 años es madre de tres hijos aún menores quienes viven en su casa propia junto a su esposo con quien tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder obtener una vivienda propia.El trabajo de consuelo consiste en realizar compras del mercado al por mayo, después ella lleva los productos a su casa para poder venderlos poniéndolo un valor agregado, esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Aquí, tiene la ayuda de sus hijos y lleva en esta actividad ya casi seis años.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para poder hacer otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que quieren ir a sorprender con el cuento del crédito, ella espera poder crecer aun mas ya que se siente joven y espera poder seguir trabajando como lo hizo hasta ahora.Este es el quinto préstamo entre Consuelo y la entidad MFP, le gusta mucho trabajar con este grupo ya que hasta ahora se mostraron todos responsables y espera poder seguir trabajando con su asesora ya que s siente cómoda igual que con la institución. Con el préstamo solicitado 2000 soles, ella comprará abarrotes para tener en stock y algunos otros productos para así poder surtir su bodega.
texts.en: Consuelo is 42 and the mother of three.  She lives with her husband, who worked hard to own their own home.  Consuelo works out of her home, buying products wholesale and selling them at a mark-up.  Her children help her with the business, which she has run for the past 6 years.  She enjoys the autonomy her business gives her, but she dislikes being surpised by customers asking for credit.  She hopes to grow her business and feels youthful and energetic to work as she has up to now.  This is Consuelo's fifth loan with MFP, and she enjoys working with this group, whose members have proven responsable. She also hopes to continue working with her advisor and feels very comfortable with the institution.  With a loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy food items and inventory stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy general food items for her store inventory

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad, ambos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga es artesana y hace varios años estuvo en una academia de corte y confección en la cual aprendió muy bien esta profesión.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde se dedica a coser ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios. También vende ropa de todo tipo la cual lo realiza puerta a puerta aunque le mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su propio taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a estas actividades y le va bastante bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo, telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy amigables y unidas.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. For example, its straw hats are known within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Ana. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children (ages 23 and 22). Both of them still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur. Ana is a seamstress and attended a sewing and dressmaking academy several years ago. This is where she learned her profession very well.

Ana has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes clothing based on the orders she receives from people who request her services. She also sells all types of clothing by going door-to-door, although most of her sales are made directly from her workshop. Ana works every day from 6am to 10pm and sometimes much later when she has orders to deliver. She has been doing this type of work for more than 10 years and has done very well.

This new loan will be used to buy clothing of all types, fabrics, thread, and other materials for sewing. Ana has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys being part of the group because her fellow members are friendly and she is close to them. Her dream is to move forward in her daily life.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Chiose

texts.en:
Chiose is 46 years old and single.  She lives in the Philippines. Chiose buys and sells pillows, curtains, and bed sheets. She has had this business for 20 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy home products such as pillows and curtains.

Chiose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Chiose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase home products such as pillows and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Edilberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rafael Edilberto; el tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es chofer de una combi de turismo que trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio de transporte las la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos para el carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is part of the “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO” in Cusco.  Rafael Edilberto is 42, married and has 2 children.  He works driving a small bus from 8:00 a.m to 9:00 p.m, and in this way supports his family.  He wants to grow his business by using this credit to buy tires and spare parts for his vehicle.  He is pleased to have access to this credit and is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos para el carro.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La socia tiene 4 hijos de 19, 13, 8, 8 años de edad, la socia  se dedica aún ala crianza de pollos, la socia compra pollos al por mayor y los lleva  a vender al por menor  a los diversos clientes que tiene en el poblado, la socia esta nuevamente solicitando el credito para invertir en la compra de 200 pollos tiernos para criarlos y una vez que alcanzan la madurez ella los vende, la socia ha creciedo con su negocio de manera favorable al punto que en esta nueva etapa ella esta duplicando el numero de pollos para criarlos y venderlos porque la socia tiene mas clientes que confian en la calidad de sus pollos; el prestamo a la socia le permite seguir creciendo y apoyar con los estudios a sus hijos. La socia reafirma su compromiso de pago y seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en: Aurelia has 4 children, aged 19, 13, 8 and 8.  She raises chickens, buying them wholesale and selling them retail to a diverse clientele in the area.  She seeks this loan in order to buy 200 chicks, and plans to raise them for re-sale.  She has grown her business successfully and is now doubling the number of chicks she is raising as her clients are growing in number and have come to trust the quality of her poultry.  This loan will also allow her to support her children's studies.  She is committed to prompt repayment and will continue to work hard to do so.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Binta. She is a widow and has three children, aged 21, 18 and 10. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is her relative.  

In 1994, Binta established her foodstuffs, beverages and drinks business. She began her business by selling drinks to passengers traveling to Freetown. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Binta has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase a new type of drink sold at Le 22,000 per gallon. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Binta plans to build a house and educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for foodstuffs, beverages and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is married with one child. She is 21 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Maria Cecilia sells a variety of snacks and barbecue to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase pork for barbecue, plus flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients for snacks vending.

Maria Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 9 months.

loans.use: to purchase pork for barbecue, plus flour, sugar, and milk for snacks vending

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Tupee

texts.en: Tupee is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children between 10 and 20 years old, who are in school and live at home. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in her community. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to attend college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 27 years old, not married, and yet very devoted to his farming business. He is a college graduate but has not been able to find a better job because of the employment crisis in this country. For this reason, Jefferson is dedicated full-time to operating his farming business. He works hard and patiently cares for his business in order to get better crop yields.

To provide his parents with a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to continue financing his business. This loan would be used to purchase seed corn and fertilizer for his corn field. He hopes for further growth and improvement of his business, and to increase his yield by the next harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and fertilizer for his corn field.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of four and 10. Two of them go to school. 

Muhamad runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for nine years. He has no employees. Muhamad heard about Finance Sudan from fellow clients in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 1000 to purchase items like milk, cooking oil, biscuits, sweets, Nomi, and others. Muhamad has no source of income other than this business.

In five years time, Muhamad hopes to build a house before the children are increased in number.

His major challenges include home expenses being too high.

Muhamad says that he has become better because of Finance Sudan; he is raised up financially.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, cooking oil, biscuits, sweets, Nomi, and others.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a widower with three grown-up children. The whole family lives in Isabela. For the last ten years, Fidel has been growing corn and rice. 

Fidel plans to use a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more seed and fertilizer for his farm.

Fidel very much hopes to gain additional profit from his farming business in order to finish long-needed repairs on his home next year.

loans.use: to buy more seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther  solicita un préstamo para poder iniciar la construcción de un cuarto; el cual les falta para que todos los integrantes de la familia tengan su espacio personal. 
Doña Maria Esther  trabaja como vendedora de teléfonos móvil con una antigüedad de cinco años,  y su esposo como  chofer de un taxi  actividad que tiene practicando más de 14 años.
Ambos son originarios de Nuevo Laredo, tiene tres hijas, una de ellas ya esta casada y las otras dos aun viven con ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther is requesting a loan so that she can begin the construction of a room. Everyone in her family lacks their own personal space.

Doña Maria Esther works as mobile phone saleswoman and has five years of experience. Her husband is a taxi driver who has been in that profession for more than 14 years. Both of them are from Nuevo Laredo. They have three daughters, one of whom is already married while the other two live with them.

loans.use: to begin the construction of a room in her house.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has raised ten children and works to make a better future for them. She never finished elementary school but Fatma uses her skills, learned from her mother, to create an income. Fatma creates knitted clothing such as scarves, hats, ponchos and winter clothing. She has been able to create additional monthly income and help her family. 

Fatma needed this loan to purchase wool, string, patterns, supplies and materials.

Fatma wants to send her daughter to college and dreams of further expanding her business to include additional items and clothing.

loans.use: To purchase wool, string, patterns, supplies and materials.

loans.name: Bertha Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berta de 44 años de edad, es casada, vive con una de sus dos hijas en su casa en Valle al sur de Honduras, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y le apoya económicamente.
Doña Berta desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la confección de prendas para damas como trajes, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc., con esta actividad a podido sacar delante a su  familia, esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para confeccionar los trajes, 
Doña Berta pretende que con las utilidades de este préstamo invertido en su negocio mejorara sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, Ella desea que su negocio crezca y que su familia prospere. 
El sueño de Doña Berta es tener su casa con piso de cerámica.
texts.en:
Bertha is 44 years old, is married and lives with one of her two daughters in her house in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. Her husband is a mason and he supports her economically.

For twenty years, Bertha has dedicated herself to the creation of clothing for women like suits, dresses, skirts, pants, etc. Through this activity she has been able to get ahead with her family. She is requesting $525 to buy fabrics, buttons, threads and other accessories to create the suits.
Bertha intends to use the proceeds of this loan, invested in her business, to better the condition of her life and the life of her family. She desires for her business to grow and for her family to prosper.

Bertha's dream is to have a house with a ceramic floor.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, threads and other accessories for her business.

loans.name: Laureano

texts.es: Don. Laureano, tiene 33 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por siete miembros cinco hijos y los dos padres, es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, viven en el municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce papa, frejol y cebolla; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Don Laureano es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de su familia. Por el desborde del rio Moqontuyu, ha perdido sus cultivos de frejol, papa, maní y una cuarta hectárea de terreno cultivable. Don Laureano, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia,, y poder recuperarse antes estos desastres naturales.
texts.en:
Laureano is 33 years of age. There are seven members in his family: five children and the two parents. It is a humble family with few economic resources. They live in the small town of Mizque, in the Cochabamba department. He works in agriculture and livestock. He grows potatoes, beans and onions, which he sells in his home town to the businesses in Mizque. 

Laureano is a well-respected member of his community because of his dedication to his work and also because he is the one who takes responsibility for his family's education and food requirements.

He lost his potato, bean and groundnut crops, as well as a quarter hectare of arable land, when the River Moqontuyu burst its banks. Laureano is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertiliser and agrochemicals and to improve his family’s situation, so as to be able to recover from this natural disaster.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers and agrochemicals

loans.name: Moch, Rizky

texts.en:
M.Rizki is a student which come from Cibeber. and he takes electricity program study in his school. but he has some trouble about Costs for pay school, so he must hard work for find some budget for his school costs.
but all of trouble now was nothing because KOMIDA and KIVA gave loan to him for continue the school and that's really helpful for him.

loans.use: To Pay Monthly costs of school

loans.name: Jan Carlos

texts.es:
Jan Carlos con 22 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive en casa familiar, junto a su madre y su hermano menor,en el distrito de Cayalti,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a las actividad de la crianza y venta de animales,con 1 año de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su engorde y venta por las fiestas que se acercan, de esta manera generara ingresos aprovechando las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo.

Jan Carlos es socio recurrentes para Edpyme Alternativa, con 02 créditos anteriores, los cuáles fueron cancelados de manera oportuna. .

loans.use: para la compra de cerdos para su engorde

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Born in Baguida in 1960, Mrs. Adjovi G. became a widower in 2003. Her husband’s job as a motorcycle engine mechanic was not enough to leave any inheritance for her. Today, she takes care of six (6) orphans who attend school, as well as her parents. With her small savings made from selling ice water on the side of the road, Mrs. G. invested in traditional local chicken raising. In 2004, she received some training in pastoral agriculture, which has given her the strong desire to invest in laying hens. Mrs. G. received a first loan that she repaid before the deadline. Her secondary school education allows her to grasp vital information on credit management. She is currently hoping for a credit of $950 to enhance her poultry house and purchase chicks and feed. The success of this business will increase her savings and strenghten her capacity to meet her needs and those of her orphan children and of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Baguida, Madame Adjovi G. devenue est veuve depuis 2003. La profession de mécanicien 2 roues de son mari ne lui a pas permis de lui laisser un héritage. Aujourd’hui, elle a à sa charge les six (06) orphelins en scolarité et ses parents. Madame G. a investi sa petite économie tirée de la vente de l’eau glacée au bord des routes dans l’élevage traditionnel des poules ordinaires. Elle a suivi en 2004 une petite formation en Agro pastoral qui suscite aujourd’hui en elle une forte envie d’investir dans les pondeuses. Madame G. a reçu un premier crédit qu’elle a soldé avant la date de remboursement. Son niveau secondaire lui confère une aptitude à mieux cerner les informations et les renseignements sur la gestion des crédits. Aujourd’hui elle attend ce crédit de $950 pour aménager son poulailler et acheter les poussins et des provendes. La réussite de cette entreprise lui fera accroître son économie et renforcer sa capacité de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins et de sa famille.

loans.use: to improve her poultry house and purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. has two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells materials for tailoring. She will use the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet (pictured in the center with her solidarity group) is applying for her first loan from Esperanza to finance her retail business that consists of selling undergarments as well as cooking ingredients such as oil and salsa, which she sells to people along the street. Janet is married to Jose Antonio, a construction worker. Together they are raising their four children: Hector Antionio (7), Alvine (6), Favian (3) Yafresi (13 months).

NOTE: Janet is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Amor y Paz (Love and Peace) Bank of Hope solidarity group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

Janet looks forward to growing her business and being able to provide more adequately for her children. She desires an opportunity to become a professional and to improve her skills and education level.

She feels strongly that her participation in the Amor y Paz Bank of Hope is a new beginning for her entire family. To Janet, Esperanza is a chance to develop strong community relationships and to create a financial safety net for her family, which will allow her children to continue their schooling past primary school.

loans.use: Purchase an inventory of undergarments and cooking supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Sharofat is married and has 2 children. She has been borrowing money from MLF MicroInvest for 2.5 years. During this time her business of selling men’s and teen clothing has undergone substantial changes. She has been able to expand her inventory and now has many regular clients.

Sharofat has a secondary education and after finishing school she did not work anywhere. Her husband also does not have a job and her business became the main source of income for Sharofat. She plans on using the loan to expand her inventory of summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Шарофат кредитуется в Микроинвест 2,5 года. В ее бизнесе произошли существенные изменения. Она продает мужскую и подростковую одежду и обувь, и за это время увеличила ассортимент товаров и теперь у нее много постоянных клиентов. Шарофат замужем и у нее 2 детей. Образование у нее среднее и после окончания школы она нигде не работала. Муж тоже нигде не работает и занятие предпринимательской деятельностью стало для Шарофат основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Сейчас она собирается расширить ассортимент летней одежды и для этого просит новый займ.

loans.use: Expansion of current business

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram has her own workshop of women garments. She opened it in 2004. She has previously studied fashion design. Several years ago, she took orders at home and had many clients. When she heard about MicroInvest she became a client and got loan in the amount of $150. She spent it for purchasing fabric and sewing them as national dresses for the market. Gradually she increased her loan and saved money for renting premises for a workshop. Today she has 4 sewing machines, one ironing board, one wide table for cutting details of clothes and one dummy at her workshop. She is requesting a loan to purchase mannequins to attract new clients to her workshop.  

In the photo you can see her mother who is a seamsress too.

loans.use: Purchasing of two mannequins

loans.name: Minh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Minh is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children who are in school. She raises pigs and chickens for eggs. Every 7-8 months, she would sell a pig (weight: 70-80 kg). The money from selling the pig is then used to pay for expenses and school fees for her children. She also owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables that she would sell at the market. Her husband, main bread winner in the family, is a construction worker like most of the men in the village. They would use part of his salary to repay the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Minh 24 tuổi, có chồng và có 2 con đang đi học. Chị nuôi gà để lấy trứng và nuôi lợn lớn để bán. Cứ 7-8 tháng chi lại xuất chuồng một con lợn khoảng 70-80 kg. Tiền bán lợn chị dành một phần để trang trải chi phí trong gia đình và chi phí học hành của 2 con. Ngoài ra chị cũng có mảnh vườn khá rộng đủ để trồng các loại rau theo mùa vụ và mang ra chợ bán. Chồng chị cũng giống như hầu hết đàn ông trong làng chủ yếu làm nghề thợ xây. Thu nhập của anh có được cũng là một nguồn tài chính hỗ trợ cho cuộc sống gia đình và dùng để hoàn vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Subhani

texts.en: I sell milk from my house. I need a loan of $350 to buy an additional cow for my dairy business. My husband works at a factory that pays very low wages. We have five children, and it's hard to manage our household expenses with our current income.  Therefore, I plan to expand my existing business. Having another cow will help us generate greater profits.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kito B Group

texts.en: Stella N. is single and the mother of one child. She supports her small family by selling new clothing, and has joined with four of her friends to secure a loan to buy more inventory. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Stella plans to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Banda B8 D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Agnes M.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand the clothes business. Agnes is 32 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 4 and 9, and her children go to school. Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land. Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Agnes is joined in her small group by Edith T., Betty N., Teopista N., and Gorette B.. Edith T. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy another sewing machine. Betty N. is currently operating a business in selling airtime/credit cards and wants a loan to add to the business. Teopista N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to buy more salon equipment like hair oils and mirrors. Gorette B. is currently in the canteen business and is requesting a loan to stock more goods and snacks.

loans.use: To trade large quantities of clothes and thus make more profits.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru:
Bahtier U. is a 46 year old male who works as an electrical mechanic in the Somonkom telephone company. He has two children. His wife is a school teacher. Bahtier U. makes enough money to provide well for his family’s life. But he wants to purchase computer and related equipment for his son's 18th birthday. This is why he decided to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Урунов Бахтиер мужчина в возросте 46 лет работает в Сомонкоме в телефоной компании мастером электриком. Имеет двоих детей. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Урунов Бахтиер зарабатывает достаточно чтоб хорошо обеспечить жизнь семьи. Но для того чтоб обновить всю оргтехнику в доме он решил взять кредит, на день рождение своего 18 летнего сына.

loans.use: To purchase computer equipment for home

loans.name: Oladuni

texts.en: Oladuni is a fashion designer with 3 sewing machines and 1 apprentice that also sells tailoring materials. She hails from Mebamun Lagos State Nigeria; she is 32 years of age and has 2 children. Oladuni acquired the skill of trading for 4 years and has been in this business since 2003. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and she is requesting a loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: De La Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Every three weeks, on Mondays, the women of De La Buena Esperanza gather in the Barranche community to attend Friendship Bridge’s repayment or savings meetings.

These women are mostly in the business of livestock breeding. The breeding of chickens, pigs and cows is a good business. Some of them breed chickens exclusively, while others combine the breeding of different animals. In actuality, it really depends on the demand in the market.

The women of De La Buena Esperanza had previously requested a loan from Friendship Bridge. They believe that receiving a loan is a great idea because it helps them greatly in their business being that this loan is one of the few - if not the only - source of credit to which they have had access.

Some of them believe that a loan is a tool they can use to, one, come out of poverty, and two, gain a certain independence. This is due to the fact that when they invest the loan in their business, and it grows along with its utility, the women will have extra income for them to invest or spend at their disposition.

However, the battle to escape poverty is long and harsh. For the time being, the women must earn enough to cover their families’ baS. needs. They mentioned that covering their household’s baS. expenses was the most difficult for them.

Through Kiva, you can help these women fight against poverty. Please support them in their fight!

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Cada tres semanas los días lunes las mujeres De la Buena Esperanza se juntan en la comunidad de Barranche para asistir a las reuniones de repago o de ahorro de Friendship Bridge.

Este grupo de señoras se dedican mayormente a la crianza de animales. La crianza de pollos, cerdos y toros es un buen negocio. Algunas señoras se dedican exclusivamente a la crianza de pollos, mientras que otras combinan la crianza de distintos animales. Realmente, depende de la demanda del mercado.

Las mujeres De la Buena Esperanza ya habían solicitado un crédito anteriormente con Friendship Bridge. Ellas piensan que solicitar un crédito es una gran idea porque las ayuda mucho en su negocio, ya que este crédito es una de las muy pocas, sino lo única, fuente de crédito a las cual ellas han tenido acceso.

Algunas piensan que el crédito es una herramienta que ellas utilizan para, uno salir de la pobreza y dos para ganar cierta independencia. Esto se debe a que cuando ellas invierten el crédito en su negocio y este crece al igual que sus utilidades, las señoras van a tener un dinero extra que ellas pueden invertir o gastar a su disposición.

Sin embargo, la lucha de salir de la pobreza es dura y larga. Por el momento, las señoras tienen que ganar lo suficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Ellas mencionaron que cubrir los gastos de la canasta básica era lo más duro para ellas.

Ustedes por medio de Kiva pueden ayudar a estas señoras a luchar contra la pobreza. ¡Acompáñenlas en su lucha!

loans.use: Invest in the breeding of animals such as chickens, pigs and cows.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhim Y. and her husband, Mr. Mit Mao,  who live across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have six children, one son and five daughters. Their oldest daughter is a garment worker and the other five children are in local schools. 

Sokhim has been selling rice for ten years.  She buys rice from the market for resale in her village. Mr. Mao is a carpenter. The couple hopes that their business will be able to support their children to study up to as high a level as possible.

So, Sokhim is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Sounkar

texts.fr:
Sounkar S., 45, is a married mother of four and a member of the Kadior village bank. Her business consists of buying cloth to make clothing, bags and tablecloths. The income she earns allows her to pay her family members’ daily expenses and improve their quality of life. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Sounkar S., 45 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kadior. Elle mène une activité qui consiste à acheter des tissus pour confectionner des habits, des sacs et des nappes de table . Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Making and selling clothing, bags and tablecloths

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 38-year-old married mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, and is a member of the Buchwa women's group. She sells secondhand clothes in the marketplace. She gets her products, especially children's and women's clothes, from Nairobi at a lower price and sells to her clients; thus she is able to maximize her income. Emily requires a US$600 loan to buy more stock of secondhand clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
J. Muyassar is 45 years old. She is married with four children. Muyassar is a very courageous woman who endured much so her four children could have a good education. The oldest children are working and can now earn their own living; the others go to school.

Muyassar is a small business owner from Isfara, Tajikistan. She sells women’s shoes at the large Central market in Isfara. Muyassar has been in this business for about 4 years. Her son (pictured here) helps Muyassar with the business. Because the holiday season is coming, she wants to buy more shoes at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. For this reason she requests a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600) for the term of 12 months to purchase a new supply of shoes to sell. This loan will help her continue to operate a successful business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Gularam

texts.en:
Gularam K., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has one child. She is engaged in the business of selling various products for use in customers' homes, so she trades small wares such as sunflower seeds, chewing gum, drop yeast, and plastic packages. Further, Gularam is involved in the livestock industry by providing low-cost feed to facilitate the growth and sales of such animals.

At present, Gularam would like to expand and improve her business. Therefore, she is seeking financial support via a Kiva business development loan in the amount of 2,400 STJ ($725) for 4 months to capitalize on the seasonal nature of her businesses.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing seasonal goods

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr:
Madame Assa H. est âgée de 31 ans et vit avec son mari et ses trois (3) enfants dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Comme il est de coutume dans le milieu traditionnel rural, elle abandonna les études pour se marier très tôt. Afin de s’insérer dans la vie active, elle décida de mener une activité génératrice de revenus. Après une phase d’apprentissage auprès de sa maman elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente de pagnes brodés et Wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest) depuis maintenant 15 ans. Jouissant d’une grande notoriété et de la maîtrise dans le domaine de la lingerie vestimentaire, sa boutique est très fréquentée par les jeunes filles et jeunes dames de la ville de Ségou.
Pour faire face à la concurrence du secteur et maintenir sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans.  Après avoir bouclé 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 50 pièces de pagnes brodés, 5 pièces de pagnes uni wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de grossistes du grand marché. Madame Assa H. vend ses articles au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de quelques hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui servira à augmenter son fonds de commerce et aider son conjoint à subvenir aux charges familiales. Son ambition est d’avoir une maison d’habitation afin de se défaire des péripéties de la location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assa H., 31, lives with her husband and her 3 children in a monogamous family in the Médine neighborhood of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

As is the custom in traditional rural areas, she left off her studies to marry at a young age. So as to get into active life, she decided to find a business that would allow her to earn money. After a period of apprenticeship with her mother, she decided 15 years ago to specialize in selling embroidered and Wax-style "pagnes" (lengths of colorful African cloth that are very much in demand in West Africa). She is well-known and very good at her specialty of wearing apparel, and her shop is frequently visited by girls and young ladies of the town of Ségou.

In order to keep up with the competition in this sector and to maintain her ever-growing clientele, she decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having repaid 4 solidarity loans (group loans) with an association in her neighborhood, she is presently on her third individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

This loan will be used to buy 50 lengths of embroidered pagnes and 5 lengths of "uni wax" pagnes. She does her buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers at the big open-air market. Mrs. Assa H. sells her items for cash and on credit to a clientele essentially composed of women and a few men.

She intends to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will be used to add to her working capital and to help her spouse with the family expenses. Her ambition is to have a family home so as to be able to move out of that neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of embroidered and wax-style lengths of African cloth

loans.name: Carola

texts.es: Carola, de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 añitos de edad. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace un año atrás a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, trabaja para una línea cosmética muy conocida a nivel nacional, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una  su buena atención y ser amable con sus clientes. Le es rentable porque cuenta con sus clientes que le compran desde que se inicio en el negocio, le va muy bien. Es su primera solicitud de préstamo con MFP. Con la cantidad solicitada quiere implementarse comprando más productos, porque así se los dejan a un precio menor y al revenderlos pueda ver mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carola, 27, lives with her husband and her 2-year-old son. A very active woman desiring to succeed, for the last year she has been selling catalog beauty products. She is working for a well-known national-level cosmetics line. What she enjoys about her work is attending and being agreeable to her clients. This is profitable for her because she has clients who have been buying since she started the business, so it is going well for her. This is her first loan request through MFP. She wants to start buying products in larger quantity, so she can buy them wholesale and earn more reselling them.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a larger stock of beauty products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are now grown. She makes a living selling undergarments and children’s clothes. She sells her goods while walking around, balancing her stock on her head as she moves from door to door.  She is very hard working and resourceful, as is her husband, which is why they were able to send all of their children to school. 

With the loan, she wants to expand and upgrade her supply of items to sell. Comfort especially wants to take advantage of Christmas festivities to make more income.  She is a member of the Awake Trust Group. Members of this group agree to help each other repay a loan, if needed.

loans.use: To buy more undergarments and clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Mrs. V., 35, is a rice farmer who lives in Trapeangveng village in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice with her husband since 1989, and her monthly income is KHR4000 ($1) per day. She has three children, all of whom are young teenagers living at home.

Her family relies on their rice farm for their income, and she always tries to improve the business. To improve their future life, V. is requesting a loan to purchase a cow to breed. In the future, the cow and its calf will help with the physical labor on the farm.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to breed

loans.name: Lungu

texts.en: Lungu Pelaghea is a hard-working person and she owns a small piece of land where she cultivates vegetables. Pelaghea faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to amend her field. To deal with this problem, Ms. Lungu is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the fields; she would use the rest of loan to purchase fuel to water the field to make her crops more productive. She has been in this business for more than 5 years.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and also fuel to water her crops

loans.name: Ines Jacqueline

texts.es:
Inés  es socia del Bancomunal  Los Claveles.
Inés es conviviente, tiene 31 años, tres hijos de 3, 9 y 12 años, estudian en la escuela estatal.
Inés vive en casa de sus padres, es allí donde su papa tenía un negocio de villar por cuatro años, pero cuando fueron llegando los nietos y creciendo vio que no era saludable para los niños, tuvo que cerrarlo y vender  todo  dándole el dinero a su hija Inés para que  empiece  un nuevo negocio. Inés  no sabía nada de negocio pero en Finca aprendió, como administrar su negocio es de bodega- bazar. 
Desde que está en Finca, ha sido una ayuda para su negocio, por las charlas que recibe, ha aprendido a ser responsable  y solidaria.
Inés necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de útiles escolares, cuadernos cartulinas, lapiceros, y compra de golosinas, galletas, chocolates, para la bodega.  
El sueño de Inés es surgir en su negocio, y dar mercadería de calidad.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Los Claveles Communal Bank. She is 31 years old and married. She has three children, 3, 9, and 12 years old, who go to public school. Inés lives with her parents. Her father had a billiards room in the house for four years. When the grandchildren arrived and started to get older, he realized that it was not a good environment for the children. He closed the business and sold everything, giving the money to his daughter, Inés, so she could start her own business. Inés knew nothing about business, but through Finca, she learned how to run a store. Finca's talks have helped her, and she has learned to be responsible and to work together with others. Inés needs a loan for 2000 soles to buy school supplies like notebooks, posterboard, and pens, and to buy sweets like cookies and chocolates for the store. Inés hopes to excel at her business and offer quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inés needs a loan for 2000 soles to buy school supplies like notebooks, posterboard, and pens, and to buy sweets like cookies and chocolates for the store.

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en: Hamis S. is a Tanzanian businessman who is an entrepreneur. He runs two types of business at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He runs a hardware shop from which varieties of hardware items are sold.  Also, he has a business of selling many varieties of bags, including school bags, at his bag shop. He has been in business for four years. He plans to expand the business by buying more products to meet his customers' demands. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more business products.

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en: Suitupe F., 38, is married with four children.  She has two years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public, seven days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 850 Tala (~300 USD).  SPBD loans are Suitupe’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a hose, sacks of fertilizer, tomato and cabbage seeds

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 50-year-old man who lives in Tripoli in northern Lebanon. Rabih has owned a coffee shop for two years. He requested a loan of $1,500 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a coffee machine for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work and change the décor of his salon. Rabih is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. Rabih decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his coffee shop.

loans.use: Rabih will use the loan to purchase merchandise and a coffee machine for his shop

loans.name: Ni Komang Budiastri

texts.en:
Ni Komang Budiastri makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has three school-aged children. Ni Komang Budiastri has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Komang Budiastri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from DINARI and would like to borrow 5,000,000 IDR to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her second loan from DINARI. Ni Komang Budiastri plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support  her immediate family.
DNR.M-0673

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Komang Budiastri - (DNR.M-0673) merupakan 34 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Komang Budiastri memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Komang Budiastri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Budiastri menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Komang Budiastri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Komang Budiastri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Komang Budiastri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald tiene una imprenta donde realiza los trabajos de elaboración de sobres, papel membretado y folders.
Es soltero y trabaja solo, y la actividad que realiza es para poder cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y estudios.
Vive en la zona de Villa Fátima sector Huaychani de la ciudad de La Paz en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora y así poder realizar los trabajos de diseño grafico y también le servirá para sus estudios en la universidad.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Ronald has a printing business where he makes envelopes, paper with letterheads, and folders. He is single, and he works alone. He does this to be able to cover his food and educational expenses. He lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Fátima zone, Huaychani sector, city of La Paz. The loan is to buy a computer in order to be able to do graphic design. It will also help him with his university studies. This is the third time that he has asked for a loan from Impro. His good payment history makes him a good client. He has been a client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer for graphic design work in his business

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chay S., 59, has raised pigs in a pigpen behind her house for years, earning around $3 per day. She is married with three children, all of whom are married and have already started new family homes. Her husband is a rice farmer. He owns a hulling machine and provides his service to the rice cultivators in the village for a profit.

Chay S. will use the loan money to buy piglets to breed and a water buffalo to raise its future offspring for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed and a water buffalo

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia A., 34 years old, is a native of Getafe, Bohol. She is married and is the mother of four. Her former experience as a saleslady has somewhat inspired her to start her own business. With PHP 6,000.00 as starting capital, she was able to establish a small store of goods. Along with this, she also has a videoke (singing) machine and computer games to meet her neighbors’ short time leisure. 

Since she wanted to expand her business, Cresencia applied for a PHP 12,000.00 loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing micro-finance institution in the Philippines. This amount will be used to purchase more goods for the store.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for the store

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El señor Marcial tiene 65 años, esta casada con la señora Delia de 62 años tienen 7 hijos todos mayores de edad y de los cuales 5 se encuentran sirviendo en el Ejercito Paraguayo.
Anteriormente, la pareja, se dedicaba a la venta de comestibles poseían un copetín, pero luego con la ayuda y orientación de algunos familiares ingresaron al rubro de confecciones. Luego de un tiempo empezaron a trabajar en la confección de kepis (gorras) rubro en el cual hoy día ya cuentan con una gran clientela formada, la mayoría son empresas grandes que solicitan en grandes cantidades gorros para sus empleados o para regalar a clientes.
 Le gustaría mas adelante contar con un taller con mejores comodidades y nuevas maquinarias. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, entre otros elementos.
texts.en:
Marcal is 65, is married to Delia, 62, and they have 7 grown children, five of which serve in the Paraguyan Army. Before, the couple was dedicated to selling food, but later with the help and orientation of some relatives they invested in the clothing industry. After a while they started to work in making hats in which today they count on a large, established clientele, the majority of which are large businesses which ask for large quantities of hats for their employees or to give to their customers. They would like to move forward with a factory with better commodities and new machines. In this occasion they are asking for a loan to buy needles, threads and other elements.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying needles and threads among other things

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivet E., age 60, is a widow with two children, one son and one daughter. The first child is a garment worker still living at home, and the second child is married and lives outside the family home. Her sister and elderly mother also live with her. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sivet E. is pictured here on the left, with her sister. 

Mrs. Sivet E. has been a farmer since she was young.  She grows rice and vegetables.  Additionally, she has created another job cutting grass to sell for cow feed. She is requesting a loan of $200 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice.

loans.name: Cruz Esmelda

texts.es: Cruz Esmelda es soltera, trabaja docente desde hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos uno de 12 años estudiando su 6to grado de primaria y una niña de 5 años en preescolar, su compañero de vida trabaja en la finca como agricultor ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, esta solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en construcciòn de  una habitación para asi tener mas privacidad, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes, esta familia son muy queridos por su comunidad ya que esta maestra tiene 10 años de impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de su comunidad,  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 52 years old and a divorced and mother with two children. She has a boy and a girl who are in school. As a single mother she works very hard to provide for her children, especially for their education, shelter, and other expenses. She is a food vendor and she prepares and sells maize porridge in the community where she lives.  Her porridge is enjoyed by many people as breakfast. She prepares and sells it very hot through hawking. She has been in business for the last four years. Gladys requests a loan to buy bags of maize, sugar, cartoons of milk etc. before prices go up. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, firewood etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
At the age of 51 Delia B. is the only one taking care of her family because she is already a widowed. She is the one earning income for the expenses in their everyday living and expenses for the studies of her 3 children, although her 2 children has a work now she never oblige them to give her some of their salaries because they have their own family, she know that they also need it although sometimes they give their mother.

Her farming business existed for 20 years now. This became their main source of income so she does her best with the help of her oldest son to make this business grow and give them enough income. When she became a member of Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she always used the loan that she received to improve her business. So in her 8th times of making loan she will use this again for additional capital to farming business. She will buy all the necessary things needed by her business.

Because now Delia has no partner in taking care of her children she will work hard for her business to grow more, her business will became her partner to give her family a much better life.

loans.use: As additional capital for her farming business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, a 39-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 12 and 14 , all of whom attend school, owns a two-room house with electricity but no piped water. Edith, who also takes care of additional family members, resides there with six other people. For the past four years she has rented a retail shop on the outskirts of Kampala for 50000/= per month, selling day-to-day essentials on a retail basis. Edith buys her merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and thus incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include increasing transportation and product costs.

A member of MCDT for eight years, she is now requesting her twentieth loan to buy more merchandise with the goals of seeing her business grow stronger and eventually selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia Sebit is currently in the business of selling clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more goods like shoes, jackets, etc., to sell.  Cicilia is 28 years old and married to a clerk. She has six children. Her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like shoes, jackets, etc., to sell

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 35-year-old married woman with four children between 4 and 12 years old. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a three-roomed house where she lives with five people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Prossy works seven days a week in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She has a ladies’ salon in Kibuye on the Kampala-Entebbe highway. She receives an average of seven customers a day and sells to all categories of people She also sells creams to her customers. She incurs transport costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. Her major business challenges are thieves and the ever-increasing prices of hair conditioners and hair extensions.

Besides this banana business she also sells beer at her home.

Prossy has been in this business for over seven years and with MCDT for eight years. She is servicing her twentieth loan. Prossy joined MCDT because it was near her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more hair extensions and conditioners.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and hair conditioners

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is a 43-year-old married woman who currently resides in the territory of Kampong Chhnang, a province of Cambodia. She is a tailor for a garment industry and started more than four years ago. Kong S. is blessed with four children. One of her children is married and has started a new home. The other three children are single. One of her daughters works in the garment factory. Her husband is a civil servant officer for a ministry. Kong S. and her family have faced difficulties traveling to work or anywhere else, because they don’t have a vehicle. Because of this problem, Kong S. is applying for a loan to add to her little savings in order to buy a motorcycle, which she will use for the family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, abre las puertas de su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus clientes, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a sus casas. Su tienda es muy concurrida, ya que es la mejor equipada de su barrio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera hacer arreglar la infraestructura de su local.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Amanda con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad y promete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socias muy respetada por el orden que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Amanda, 42 years of age, is a simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house. What she most desires is to succeed in life. Each day, very early in the morning, she opens the doors to her grocery store to tend to her customers. She is a persuasive saleswoman, and always manages to convince patrons to take something home with them. Her store is very busy, as it’s the best stocked in the neighborhood. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with customers, which is how she finds out what’s going on in the area. She has been running her store for 10 years, and finds staying in the store all day without being able to go out to be the most challenging part about her business. In the future, she hopes to make improvements to the space in which her store is located. This is Amanda’s fifth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the opportunity and promises to make all her payments on time, as she would like to continue having access to credit in the future. She is one of the most respected members of her cooperative bank since she helps keep the group organized. She plans to use the 1,500.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more products to better supply her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Mrs. Ton Y. was born in 1968 and has been married many years to Mr. Bunheang, age 49. He is a taxi driver and a construction employee. This couple has five kids. Three of the children are no longer in school and work as waiters for wedding parties while the remaining two attend school. Ton Y. is an internal employee for a non-government organization and has been doing this occupation for years. Ton Y. and her family faced difficulties with their electricity line use because their house is far from the electricity system. Due to that, Ton Y. decided to seek a loan to buy a generator to supply electricity for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur B. is 50 years old and lives with his wife, Aida, in Nerqin Hand village in the Kapan area of Armenia. Khachatur is educated and is now Nerqin Hand’s mayor. His wife is a librarian who works in the village’s library. Khachatur and his wife operate a farm where they produce meat, milk, eggs and honey.

Khachatur has a caterpillar tractor (DT-75), a wheeled tractor (MT3-82) and a utility truck that he uses on his farm. He also rents these vehicles to people in the village. He is requesting a 700,000 AMD (Armenian dram) loan to buy a mowing machine for his farm.

loans.use: To buy a mowing machine for his farm.

loans.name: Pauliine

texts.en:
Pauline O. is a poultry farmer who started her business in 2009 after quitting her job as an Early Childhood Development (ECD) tutor due to poor income. To generate income, Pauline buys her stock every two months and wants to expand her business to be able to secure, for her children, a better education for a bright future.

At the age of 32 years, Pauline is a married woman and a mother of two (2) children living in Kwirare Busia District.  She would like a loan worth Ksh.10,000 to be able to increase her stock to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and feed

loans.name: Georgina Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Georgina Mercedes D. León Sánchez cuenta con 39  años D. edad,  casada con seis hijos, actualmente se dedica al comercio entregando todo tipo cosméticos para damas y caballeros el cual diariamente tiene demanda sus productos  para entregar cosméticos diferentes lugares D. su comunidad, se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a la falta D. capital D. su negocio, ya que no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para cubrir la demanda, el cual tuvo un encargo mayor y como consecuencia no pueD. cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes en su actividad por las misma razón necesita D. más capital  para  su negocio como también poder seguir mejorando sus fuentes D. ingresos y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Georgina Mercedes D. León Sánchez, 39, is married and has 6 children. She sells all kinds of very populr cosmetics for men and women, she delivers all over her community.
