She called upon Asociación ASDIR to request funding because, lacking working capital, she does not have the cash to stock enough product to meet all her demand. She got a large order and is unable to meet demand of her other customers. She needs funds, therefore, to increase stock and to continue to improve her source of income thereby giving her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ngagne

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ngagne D. est un homme marié et père de 6 enfants dont les âges varient entre 2 mois et 20 ans. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Il gère une boutique depuis qu’il a quitté la Mauritanie en 1990. En fait, Monsieur D. fait parti des sénégalais qui ont réussi à regagner le Sénégal lors des tristes événements Sénégalo-mauritanien de 1989 amenant même chaque pays a rapatrié ses ressortissants, grâce à un pont aérien offert par l'Algérie et le Maroc. 
C’est ainsi que de son retour, Monsieur D. qui avait laissé tous ses biens en Mauritanie se lança dans le commerce. Il demande, cependant, un prêt de 500 000 FCFA pour renforcer son commerce. Il compte s’approvisionner en marchandises alimentaires (riz, sucre, thé, huile….etc).  Avec les bénéfices qu’il espère tirer de ce financement, Monsieur Ngagne D. veut aménager une autre boutique à Sao un village pas très loin de Notto.
texts.en:
Mr. Ngagne D. is a married man, father of six children whose ages vary between two months and twenty years. His main activity is commerce. He runs a store since he left Mauritania in 1990. In fact, Mr. D. is one of many Senegalese who managed to return to Senegal during the painful events of 1989 affecting Senegal and Mauritania. Each country had to repatriate its national citizens, thanks to an airlift organised by Algeria and Morocco. This is how Mr. D., who had left all his belongings in Mauritania, started his commercial venture. He is requesting however a loan for 500,000 FCFA to strengthen his business. He will stock up on food products (rice, sugar, tea, vegetable oil, etc.). With the earnings he hopes to achieve through this investment, Mr. Ngagne D. wants to set up another store in Sao, a village not far from Notto.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply with food products

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement Takku Liggey est la sous branche de l’Association des Femmes pour le développement de l’entreprise (AFDE) présente dans la caisse de Médina Fall une caisse de U-IMCEC Thiès. 
 Cette association, l’AFDE,  est une organisation de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thiès, une ville environ 70 Kms de Dakar. L'association a été fondée en 1993 par vingt femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cette politique ne permettant pas de financer au même jour tous les membres, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, qui portent le nom de Takku Liggey dans la caisse Médina Fall, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années, mais changent souvent de membres selon le financement des besoins et d'autres considérations.
 L'AFDE organise des réunions de membre mensuellement où tous les sous groupes et branches sont conviés et dirige une coopération pour ses membres, en leur permettant d'acheter du riz et d'autres produits à de meilleurs prix.
 L'AFDE est dirigée par une Présidente du nom de Madame Mame Diarra MAR et une trésorière Madame Ndeye Ndella D. toutes habitantes de Thiès. 
Ainsi, le sous groupe Takku Liggey N°28 est à sa tête Madame Mame Bousso M. âgée de 29 ans. Cette femme mère de 4 enfants est une commerçante ambulante depuis 2 ans. Elle place à ses clients des pagnes, draps, perles et de l’encens. Elle a été influencée dans ce métier par un ami de son père qui l’encourageait et l’aidait à écouler ses produits en dehors de Thiès. Cependant pour ce crédit, elle compte s’approvisionner en produits (encens, perles, draps) pour renforcer son activité. Elle partage ce sous groupe avec :
-	Madame Khoudia S., la trésorière, vendeuse depuis un an de perles (bine-bine), draps, encens qu’elle a hérité de sa maman.
-	Madame Awa T. qui vend des produits de lessive
-	Madame Khady D.  qui s’active dans le commerce d’arachide, niébé (haricots), bissap….
-	Madame Awa F.  qui s’active également dans la vente de perles (bine-bine) encens et autres.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey group is a sub-branch of the Women's Association for Business Development (l'Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l'Entreprise - AFDE) present in the Médina Fall savings institution, which belongs to the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) in Thiès.The AFDE is an organisation of women running small businesses in Thiès, a small town which lies around 70 kilometers from Dakar. The association was founded in 1993 by 20 female entrepreneurs in order to increase their purchasing power by means of a "tontine" (a revolving fincance system whereby each member contributes an agreed amount periodically and this is passed on in rotation to different members). Since this policy does not allow all members to get funding at the same time, they decided to join the IMCEC in order to obtain a loan without being asked for guarantees. For this reason the members divided into sub-groups of five, with each of these sub-groups designating a president and a treasurer. These sub-groups, which all carry the name Takku Liggey in the Medina Fall savings institution, can retain the same members for numerous years, but often the members do change because of financing needs and other considerations. The AFDE organises members' meetings on a monthly basis where all sub-groups and branches are convened, and it also runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other products at preferential prices. The AFDE is led by a president, whose name is Mrs Diarra MAR and a treasurer, Mrs.Nedeye Ndella D., both residents of Thiès. The sub-group, Takku Liggey No. 28 is run by Mrs. Mame Bousso Baye, who is 29 years old. This woman, who has four children, has been a door-to-door saleswoman for two years. She sells pagnes (West African colourful fabric), sheets, pearls and incense to her customers. She has been influenced in this trade by a friend of her father who encouraged her and helped her to sell her products outside Thiès. With this loan she is planning to get supplies of products (incense, pearls, sheets) in order to strengthen her activity. She participates in the sub-group with: - Mrs. Khoudia S., the treasurer, who sells "bine-bine" pearls, sheets, and incense which she has inherited from her mother - Mrs. Awa T., who sells washing powder - Mrs Khady D., who is active in trading peanut, niébé beans and bissap (a refreshing drink made from hibiscus flowers). - Mrs. Awa F., who also sells "bine bine pearls, incense and other items.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen their different activities

loans.name: Kipailoi

texts.en:
Kipailoi L. is 43 years old. He is married to Naishuluni L. and is the father of six school-going children. Kipailoi is a farmer who farms his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from other members who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to do large-scale farming for wheat which does very well in this area. With the profits, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land to plant more wheat and farm other agricultural products on a large scale. Kipailoi believes he is hard-working needing only the resources in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To do large-scale wheat farming

loans.name: Pita

texts.en:
Pita S. is currently in the business of importing and selling rolls of bedsheets from Khartoum, and is requesting a loan to import more rolls of bedsheets to sell.  Pita is a 45-year-old married woman, and her husband is the director of labour office. She has seven children who go to school. With the extra profits that she could earn from her loan, she hopes to build a departmental store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Import more rolls of bedsheets  to sell

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio , de 42 años , convive con su pareja , y tienen un hijo  Samuel (9) .Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.Ante las adversidades siempre siguió adelante y su meta era tener su propio negocio con el tiempo. Luego empezó a producir cacao en una pequeña parcela, y todo lo que cosechaba lo vendía a los  minoristas, pero él no se sentía a gusto , porque pagaban poco y existía un compromiso por largo tiempo. En la actualidad produce y comercializa cacao, café y hoja de coca, y reconoce que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, además sus ventas han crecido de manera constante. Por lo general sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad y cuenta con la ayuda  de sus  peones que le facilitan la extracción de sus productos agrícolas. Sus aspiraciones futuras son ambiciosas, a tal punto que quiere  ampliar su terreno de cultivo, en otras localidades, con la finalidad de captar nuevos clientes .Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y  agradece a la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que brindan, es mas asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago. Además le va muy bien con  su banco comunal, ya que existe un clima cordial entre todos los integrantes. Claudio tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en pagar su terreno que adquirió en la ciudad ,con el propósito de construir su casa, y brindarle educación superior a su hijo.
texts.en:
Claudio, 42 years of age, lives with his partner and together they have a son, Samuel (9). They live in the Santa Rosa community, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. Before adversity hit, he always forged ahead and his goal was to establish his own business over time. Later, he started to produce cacao on a small parcel of land and sold everything he harvested to retailers. Despite this, however, he did not feel content because they paid little and required a long-term commitment. Currently, he produces cacao, coffee and coca leaves, and he acknowledges that he has a large customer base. In addition, his sales have grown in a consistent manner. He generally sells his merchandise in the areas near where he lives, and counts on the help of his laborers to help him with his agricultural endeavors. His future aspirations are ambitious, to the point where he would like to expand his harvest lands into other localities in order to capture new customers. This is his second loan with MFP, and he thanks the institution for the access to credit that they facilitate and commits to fulfilling his payment obligations. In addition, things are going very well for him with his cooperative bank as there is a cordial atmosphere among all the members. Claudio plans to invest the requested funds to pay for land he acquired in the city. His goals are to build a house and to provide a superior education for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for land where he will build a house.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de La Florida, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de San Miguel perteneciente a la región Cajamarca y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus dos hijos hizo que hace diez años iniciara un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en su domicilio, con mucho esfuerzo pudo mantenerlo desde sus inicios y poco a poco se hizo conocida en la zona, actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de productos de uso diario. Con el pasar de los años incursionó también el el servicio de alquiler de videojuegos (play station). Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella responde por el mantenimiento de sus hijos y colabora con la economía de su familia.

Anastacia desea adquir mas productos para poder brindar una mayor variedad a sus clientes y de esa manera satisfacer aun mas sus necesidades, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Anastacia es una mujer que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que conlleva ser madre soltera. En la zona donde vive se ha sabido ganar el respeto y estima de sus vecinos que siempre acuden a ella ante cualquier necesidad.
texts.en:
Anastaicia, 48, is a single mother; she has two children and lives in her parents’ house located in La Florida district, an agricultural district of San Miguel province belonging to the Cajamarca region, located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. Needing to support her two children led her to set up a general store in her home 10 years ago. It took much effort to keep it afloat at the beginning but gradually she became better known in the area and currently has a good base of regular customers who come to her store to stock up on items of daily use. As years went by, she also went into the Play Station games rental business. Her earnings from both these ac tivities allow her to support her children and contribute to her family’s finances. Anastacia wants to acquire more products to provide more variety for her customers thereby meeting more of their needs. This has led to her first, 1000 new sol, loan request from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach this goal. Anasacia is a woman who has learned how to get ahead despite the difficulties being a single mother entails. She has earned the respect and esteem of her neighbors who always come to her for whatever they need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia D. F.   es cliente recurrente, es casada, vive en casa propia y tiene 3 hijos. 
La misma cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio desD. el año 2000 contando con buena clientela a la fecha, dicho negocio son manejados por la Ella y su marido el Sr. Modesto F..
El préstamo que solicitó fue para la compra D. mercaderías para su negocio como panificados, enlatados, pastas, lacteos, embutidos.
texts.en:
Celia D. F. is a repeat client. She is married, lives in her own home and has three children. Since 2000, she has had a store in her home with good customers to date. She and her husband, Modesto F., manage the business. The loan that she asked for was for the purchase of items for her store, like dairy, baked and canned goods, pastas and sausages.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy, baked and canned goods, pastas and sausages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: La Cuahutemoc Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la cuauhtemoc decidieron  ponerle este nombre puesto que asi se llama la colonia donde viven y todas los integrantes pertenecen a esta misma.
La historia es acerca de la señora Yolanda N. H., ya que es la representante del grupo, ella es casada su esposo se llama Pedro, cuenta con 30 años de edad y aun no tienen hijos, se dedica a la venta de tamales, carne enchilada y chorizo.
 
Yolanda se decidió por ese negocio ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda ya que únicamente vende en su casa y le deja muy buenas ganancias, además tiene muchos clientes, ella ya lleva mas de 5 años con su  negocio e invirtirá su crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos como son: tomates, chiles, ajos, hojas, condimentos y la carne ya que es lo que mas necesita. 
 
Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio ella esta ahorrando para  construir uN. barda a su casa y también esta apoyando a su esposo con el sustento de la casa aunque no son muchos los gastos ya que solamente son ellos dos
 
Comenta que su negocio ésta beneficiando a los vecinos de su colonia, ya que no hay muchas personas que vendan ahí cerca, puesto que todas se van a vender al mercado y ella aprovecha por que algunos de sus vecinos no les gusta salir hasta el centro y así que como ella esta mas cerca van a comprar ahí, también por la atención y servicio que les brinda. 
 
El sueño de doña Yolanda es el de construir un local ahí mismo en su casa para poner uN. carnicería y también quiere tener hijos.
 
Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables y pagadoras ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien.
 
Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.
 
Los integrantes del grupo "Cuauhtemoc" y las actividades a las que se dedican son:
Yolanda N. H.-venta de tamales y carne (representante)
JorgiN. Vázquez-perfumería
Ruperto macedonio garcía N.-pescadería
Guadalupe M. Pérez-polleria
Celsa victoriaN. Rodríguez Martínez-deposito de refrescos
Inés margarita López Gutiérrez-club nutricional
Nicasio López R.-agua de garrafón
Apolonia Hernández S.-tienda de ropa
MarceliN. López R.-perfumería
Epifanía M.-antojitos
Silvia López López-taller de costura
ReiN. Z. Juárez-pescadería
texts.en:
This group is called “Cuahutemoc” because it is the name of the neighborhood where all of the members reside. The focus of this description will be the story of Sra. Yolanda N. H., the group representative. She is 30 years old and married to her husband Pedro. They still do not have children. Yolanda sells tamales, meat enchiladas, and chorizo sausage.

Yolanda decided to pursue this business of the great demand that exists. She only sells from home and is able to generate good earnings since she has many customers. Yolanda has already been in business for five years and will invest her loan in the purchase of more ingredients used in making her products. Tomatoes, chili peppers, garlic, banaN. leaves, condiments, and meat are the items that she needs the most.

With the profits from her business, Yolanda is saving toward the construction of a security wall around her house. She also supports her husband with maintaining their household since they have many expenses between the two of them.

She says that her business is a benefit to the neighbors in her area since there are few people who sell locally. All of the vendors sell at the market, so she takes advantage of the few residents who do not like to travel to the center of town. In addition to being close to her neighbors, she is known for the attention and service that she provides. Doña Yolanda dreams of adding a space to her house where she can open a butcher shop. She also wants to have children.

Yolanda says the members of her group are very responsible people who complete their payments on time. They know one another and get along very well. She is extremely grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for their support by providing this loan. Her business is improving as a result of this assistance.

The members of the Cuahutemoc Group and their business activities are listed below: • Yolanda N. H., group representative – sells tamales and meat • JorgiN. Vázquez – sells perfumes • Ruperta Macedonio García N. – sells fish • Guadalupe M. Pérez – sells chickens • Celsa VictoriaN. Rodríguez Martínez – sells soft drinks out of a warehouse • Inés Margarita López Gutiérrez – sells nutritional products through a membership club • Nicasio López R. – sells jugs of water • Apolonia Hernández S. – manages a clothing store • MarceliN. López R. – sells perfumes • Epifanía M. – sells snacks • Silvia López López – operates a sewing workshop • ReiN. Z. Juárez – sells fish

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, chili peppers, garlic, banana leaves, condiments, and meat

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn C., from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz, is 31 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anelyn owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she is now requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be Anelyn's fourth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose J. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 21 years-old and unmarried with a baby. To make a living, Mary Rose owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling fish in the local community. Mary Rose is just starting this business.

In 2010, Mary Rose joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Rose is requesting a first loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Higidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN D. LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higidia; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella tiene unos terrenos y también tiene como actividad la agricultura en las épocas D. siembra y cosecha, La socia trabaja vendiendo todo tipo D. artesanía, desD. piedras exóticas, cuarzos, bisutería, tejidos, bordados y demás. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería como hilos D. colores, cuarzos y alambres D. alpaca para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Higidia, 56, is a member of the “VIRGEN D. LA O” communal bank located in Yucay district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She is married and has four children. She is a craftsperson and also engages in farming during planting and harvest time. She works selling all kinds of crafts like: exotic stones, quartz, jewelry, weavings, embroidery, etc. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise for her business, like colored thread, quartz and silver wires. She takes this opportunity to thank all those who participate in this dream through this medium and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business (colored thread, silver wire, quartz)

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. has enjoyed spending the profits from her farming business because it has enabled her to sustain the needs of her family and improve their lives. That encourages her to work harder and plan further for her business and family. Lilia wants to take the opportunity to grow her business by requesting another loan of 27,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for additional business capital to grow more rice to sell.

Her long-term goal is to have a successful farming business to support her family financially. With the support of Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor. Lilia’s wish to offer her children the hope for a better life fuels her pledge to her project.

loans.use: to support and maintain her farming business.

loans.name: Kholik

texts.en:
H. Kholik is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his five children. Kholik has been characterized as a person who is hard-working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. 

In spite of this, Kholik is determined to raise the standard of living in his family and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, de 55 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Carmen de 47 años, y de 2 de sus 4 hijos, pues los mayores trabajan y son independientes. Cada día es de lucha constante para este trabajador hombre, pues desde muy joven quiso brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Desde hace 20 años, se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, es chofer para diversas empresas de transporte público y  afirma que el trabajo es tedioso pues maneja 15 horas diarias sin interrupción durante 5 días a la semana y solo descansa 2 días. Se esfuerza por brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida con las ganancias de su trabajo y le  entretiene pasear por las calles cubriendo la ruta de su zona. Durante sus ratos libres ayuda a su esposa en la atención de su pequeña tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa. Como es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro quiere mejorar el negocio de su esposa para que crezca y obtengan mejores ganancias que las actuales. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso; ya que le gusta el trabajo con su grupo pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Lorenzo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería que necesita su esposa para surtir mejor su tienda, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, age 55, lives in his own home with his wife Carmen, age 47, and two of their four children. The older children work and are independent. Each day is a struggle for this hardworking gentleman. From a young age, he has tried to provide the best for his family. For the past 20 years, Lorenzo has been providing transportation services as a driver for different public transportation companies. He says the work is tedious since he drives continuously 15 hours each day. Lorenzo works five days a week and only has two days of rest. He strives to provide his family with a good quality of life with the earnings from his job driving through the streets that make up his local route. During his free time, Lorenzo helps his wife manage her small grocery store located in their house. Being a very enterprising gentleman, he wants to improve his wife’s business so that they can generate more income than what they earn today.

This is his first loan with MFP. Lorenzo promises to submit his payments on time because he does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible so that he can continue working and making progress. He enjoys working with his Communal Bank since all of the members are responsible and supportive of one another. Lorenzo plans to invest the loan he requested in the purchase of merchandise his wife needs to restock her store in hopes of improving their income and continue moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his wife's store

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a dairy farmer who lives in the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been farming for three years and has two employees. His main product is milk, which he sells in the local market. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of maize. He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and provide for the basic needs of his family. He says that his major problem has been various diseases which are costly to treat. In the future, he would like to acquire five high-quality dairy cows able to produce more than 60 litres of milk daily.

Solomon is 35 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children who range in age from 2 to 11. Three of his children are currently in school.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Nancy. She is married and has two children ages 17 and 6. In 2007, Nancy established her materials business in order to generate income. Her business is open seven days a week, six hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add more fabrics to her business. In the future, Nancy plans to expand and add additional stock to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for resale

loans.name: C4368  Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Christoph is 34 years-old and married with four children aged between  three and 12.  Christoph is the leader of the group which is called JYAMBERE in the local language. This group contains five male members.

Christoph, who is the leader, has ten years experience selling various styles of clothing. His shop is open from 7h30 a.m until 8 p.m every day.

Christoph and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their business through purchasing more products for their shops. This loan will allow them to satisfy the demand of their customers. Christoph hopes to earn more profits which will allow his to save money for the future and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. G., from the village of West Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon, is 27 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products including snack foods and beverages, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to enhance her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en: Lorenzo T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 45 years old. Lorenzo is married. To make a living, Lorenzo raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lorenzo also operates a habal-habal (motorcycle transport) service. Lorenzo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorenzo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lorenzo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is currently in business selling rice, onions, cooking oil and sugar.  She is 38 years old and is married, with 6 children.  Five of them go to school.  She requested a loan so that she can stock more rice, onions, cooking oil and sugar, and gain extra profits.  Jane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more rice, onions, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

Alex has a business of selling milk. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Alex sells her products door-to-door.    

Alex has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of milk. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Alex include debtors and the ever-increasing prices of milk.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own milk coolers and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.   

Alex lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie E. is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, a motorcycle transport business and a farm. 

Her husband, Robert Glenn E., who is 34 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. 

They have two children who are 1 and 6 years old. 

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs. 

Rosalie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Anju D..  She is married and has two children aged 16 and 11.  In 2000, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

 In the future, Anju plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work with their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's "kurta surwal" and men's "daura surwal".  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:

 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Emma Miriam

texts.es:
Emma de 21 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y una hija de 21 años de edad, ellos viven en casa alquilada, administran el negocio desde hace 3 años, trabaja a tiempo completo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de celulares y accesorios, cargadores, estuches entre otros, este préstamo la ayudara a compara lo necesario para el negocio y atender mejor a los clientes.

Su aspiración es tener casa propia y ver crecer el negocio, que a través de él pueda tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Emma is 21 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán.  She sells mobile phones and accessories for a living. Her family is comprised of her husband and 21 year-old daughter.  They all live in a rental property.  She has been running her business for three years and works full time.

She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones and accessories (chargers and cases, among other things).  The loan will help her buy what she needs for the business to improve customer service.

Her goal is to have her own home and expand business so she can improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories (chargers, cases, etc.)

loans.name: Santos Teresa

texts.es:
Santos tiene 25 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 años de edad y dos meses, por el momento vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, este negocio tiene 6 años de existir, está ubicado en el mercado municipal, trabaja todos los días de la semana y junto a su madre lo atienden.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para  la compra de pescado seco, dicha inversión se debe a que se acerca la semana santa, tiempo en crece la demanda del pescado, esto será una gran ayuda para Santos, ya que estará aumentando el negocio y la capacidad para atender a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener mejores ingresos, aprovechar la temporada para vender más cantidad y que le quede una mayor ganancia, al mismo tiempo poder construir su propia casa y dar lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is 25 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  She is a single mother and has two children: one is 8 years old and the other is 2 months old.  Santos currently lives with her mother and her business is selling dried fish.  She has had this business for six years and it is located in the town market.  Santos works every day of the week together with her mother.

Santos is currently requesting a loan to buy dried fish.  This investment is necessary because 'Semana Santa' (Holy Week) is approaching.  During this period, the demand for fish increases.  This will be a great help to Santos since she will be able to increase her business and her ability to serve her customers.

Santos' goals are to make more income, to take advantage of the season in order to make more sales and to make more profits so that she can build her own home and provide her children with what they need.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Milagros De Mozoquilpan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “MILÁGROS DE MOZOQUILPAN”,  está ubicado en el Estado de México, El grupo está conformado por 9 clientas, en este grupo se encuentra la señora Berenice P. M., es la presidenta del grupo.  Tiene de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta 3er grado de secundaria, su ocupación es comerciante de tortillas, servilletas y manteles, y tiene en total 2 hijos: 1 mujer y 1 varón, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, solicitó su préstamo para comprar maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.Nos platica que su negocio cada día va mejorando ya que cuenta con más clientes, se siente muy entusiasmada por la compra de material para la elaboración de más producto que le han solicitado sus clientas y que por falta de recursos no ha podido surtir y de sus ganancias poder abastecer lo indispensable para el sustento de su familia y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Miracles of Mozoquilpan” and is based in the State of Mexico. The group is made up of 9 members, including Berenice P. M., the group’s president. She is 28 years old, has completed 3 years of secondary school and makes a living selling tortillas, napkins and tablecloths. She has 2 children: 1 girl and 1 boy.
She requested this loan to buy corn for making tortillas. She tells us that her business improves every day as her customer base grows. She is very excited about purchasing supplies to increase production and meet customer demand, which, for lack of resources, she has been unable to meet. She is also happy about the profits that will allow her to provide for her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en:
Burastan M. is from the village of Haykavan in the Shirak region of Armenia. Haykavan has abundant nature, especially for farming.  

Burastan has been engaged as a private entrepreneur for over 35 years. She is married with four children: three daughters (32, 34 and 36 years old) and a 27-year-old son. 

She is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She will seed one hectare of her irrigated land with potato seeds and expects her income this year to increase by 20 percent. She is impressed by the services of microfinance and wants to continue growing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos Rogué  B.  vive en Pilas de Pérez Zeledón y se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura.
Don Santos tiene una pequeña finquita en la cual quiere sembrar granos básicos. Específicamente maíz y frijoles. Para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra de los tubérculos. 
El espera sacar provecho de la temporada y aumentar sus ingresos, para el beneficio de su familia.
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Santos Rogué B. lives in Pilas de Pérez Zeledón and has been a farmer all his life.  He has a small farm where he wants to plant basic grains, specifically corn and beans.  

But he needs a ₡500 000 (five-hundred thousand colones) to buy farming supplies necessary to plant the tubers.  He hopes to take advantage of this season and increase his income for his family’s benefit.  

He is a member of the La Danta S.A. communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social enterprises in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Amelita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from buying and selling copra (coconut meat) . Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika représentante du groupe d’affaire « Tusaidiane »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous étudient. Elle fait l’artisanat, la forgerie de  fabrication des braseros à travers le sol d’argile. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans la commercialisation de ces produits. Elle étale ces braseros au long de la route, sur les différents points de vente. Signalons que ces braséros réduisent le cout de consommation de braises. D’où, sa contribution sur la conservation de l’environnement. Il ya 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  18 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  la terre d’argile, 10 tôles, quelques carcasses, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une clôture autour de sa résidence.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Tusaidiane» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client named Masika, representative of the business group called « Tusaidiane » is a 45-year-old entrepreneur, married and the mother of five children, all enrolled in school. She is an artisan, making fired brasiers using clay. She and her husband share the duty of selling the products. She sets up her brasiers alongside the road, at different sales points. Please note that these clay brasiers reduce the cost and use of charcoal, so she contributes to protecting the environment. She has been in this business for 10 years, however, she has just completed her 18th loan with Hekima. 

This new loan will serve to buy clay, 10 pieces of sheet metal, etc. She also wants to pay school fees for her children and build a fence around her property. The client thanks Hekima for working on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banks. Please also note that the business group  « Tusaidiane» is made up mostly of women.

loans.use: to buy clay, 10 pieces of sheet metal, etc.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a young woman married to Hatem; they have no children. They live in Palestine, where Haya's husband runs a grocery store. 

Haya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a wider variety of grocery items in order to attract more customers. Grocery stores are highly competitive due to their increasing number. 

Haya is a conservative woman, so her husband appears in the photograph in her place.

loans.use: to increase store inventory, attract more customers, and have a better income

loans.name: Eleseo

texts.en: Eleseo, a 35-year-old married father of two children aged 11 and 10, is a farmer growing rice and corn crops in Sta. JOsefa, Agusan Del Sur. He earns about 3000 PHP per month from this business. Eleseo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs and hopes to have a stable business that will help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama makes cassava powder (as shown in the picture) in Efutu-Mampong near Abura in Cape Coast.  Cassava powder is used in the preparation of a local dish called “kokontey”.   She has been in this business for 8 years.  She also sells charcoal.    

Ama is single and has 6 children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy cassava to process into powder to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: buy cassava to process into powder to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.fr:
Client de 54 ans, celibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge,apres la guerre de 1997, il perd son travail et se lance dans la vente de la viande de chasse dans le marche, il s'approvisionne a la gare routiere du Nord et Sud du pays, il achete la viande de chasse en entier tel que les antilopes, les biches, les singes ...

Ses potentiels  clients sont les restaurateurs,car cette viande est tres appreciee et ses ventes sont de de 65000 a 150.000 frs par semaine.
A l'octroi de son pret il va faire une grande provision de viande de chasse boucanee et fraiche tel que 10 antilopes, 10 biches, 15 singes,5 sangliers, 5 porc epics et 10 gazelles.
Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un boucherie de viande fraiche a tout saison, et avec ses benefices il va epargner et assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 54 years old, single, with 3 dependent children. After the war in 1997, he lost his job and began selling game meat at the market. He obtains his supplies at the bus stations in the north and south of the country. He buys the complete animal as meat, such as antelope, deer, monkey. His potential customers are restaurateurs, as this meat is very much sought after and his weekly sales vary between 65,000 and 150,000 francs. 

When he receives his loan, he will buy a large quantity of game meat, both smoked and fresh, such as 10 antelopes, 10 deer, 15 monkeys, 5 wild pigs, 5 porcupines and 10 gazelles. His ambition is to open an all-season butcher's shop, and with his profits, he will save for his children's future.

loans.use: to buy game meat

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 47 years of age and living with her partner in life. She has been running her motorcycle transport for eight years and it is the main source of income of the family. Though she has a separate house from her father, still she is responsible for his daily needs. 

Francisca has also been engaged in the hog and poultry raising business for two years. She is glad because though she is female still she proves to herself that she can drive and earn profit through her own motorcycle transport. She is grateful because she has her own customers that she fetches going to and from the school.

She would like to ask for an additional capital amount of P20,000 which will be used to purchase wheels for her motorcycle transport and sustain their daily needs. She hopes that she can improve her motorcycle transport and save money for her security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to purchase wheels for her transportation business.

loans.name: San Cristobal De Aparquilla Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN CRISTOBAL D. APARQUILLA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado D. Aparquilla, en la Provincia D. Anta y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia  Marina; tiene 57 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos vivos, D. 31,26,20 años D. edad; la socia trabaja en el comercio D. cereales y productos secos, la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ella tiene terrenos D. cultivo, la socia siembra maíz blaco y amarillo; la socia también venD. en las diferentes comunidades cereales como trigo, maíz, amarillo, maíz morado, maíz blanco, frejoles, habas, cebada y los días miércoles D. cada semana la socia lleva sus productos a la provincia D. Urubamba ella los venD. alla y ya tiene sus contactos; la socia desea invertir el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo al por mayor ya que tiene unos clientes que la buscan y desean comprarle maíz amarillo para preparar jora que es el principal ingrediente D. la chicha D. jora, la socia invertirá el crédito en la compra D. maíz amarillo.
La socia Juana se encuentra en un costado D. la foto grupal debido a que la socia Juana estuvo D. viaje el día d ela reunion y se ha incorporado el día D. hoy  por la mañana, firmando todos los acuerdos para el prestamo del credito. E s por esta razón que la socia se tomo la foto fuera del grupo.

Los otros socios se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, a la crianza D. animales menores y al comercio minorista en general.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “San Cristóbal D. Aparquilla” communal bank located in the town of Aparquilla in Anta Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Marina, 57.  She’s married and has three living children who are 31, 26 and 20 years of age.  She’s a cereal and dry goods merchant.  Her main activity is farming.  She has fields where she grows white and yellow corn.  She also sells various grains like wheat, yellow corn, purple corn, white corn, beans, Lima beans and barley in different communities and every week on Wednesdays she takes her products to Urubamba Province and sells them there; she already has her contacts.

She wants to use the loan to buy yellow corn at wholesale because she has some customers that seek her out because they want to buy yellow corn to prepare “jora” which is the main ingredient in “chicha D. jora” (corn-based beverage).  She will invest the loan in the purchase of yellow corn.

[The member Juana’s picture appears to the siD. of the group photo because on the day the meeting took place she was traveling but she came back this morning to sign all the agreements for the loan; this is why she took a picture separate from the group.]  The other group members are farmers, raise livestock and small farm animals and are general retailers.

The member is grateful for the support she’ll get and pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn.

loans.name: Aruinaa

texts.en: Aruinaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  Her husband is disabled and stays at home.  Aruinaa started her business in 2005 by making felt arts and coral souvenirs.  Now she sells the products and souvenirs at Ulaanbaatar City.  She has many years of experience and has a regular client base.  In the future, she plans to export the products and souvenirs to the neighboring cities of China.  She is also a member of the Mongolian Hand-Craft Association.  She is a diligent and hard-working woman who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and other supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and other supplies for her hand craft business.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, who is 30 years old, resides in the province of Siem Reap, an area full of ancient temples. She sells food and drinks and earns $9 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. This couple does not have any children yet. Every month, San has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses.

San would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She also wants to expand her business to buy more kinds of drinks and to make more kinds of food because now there are many guests visiting the ancient temples.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de yogurt y también la socia se dedica a trabajar en un laboratorio, la socia el negocio de elaboración de yogurt lo dedica en forma independiente, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de elaboración de yogurt y mejorar en su trabajo de laboratorio.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar el yogurt como azúcar, leche y vasos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to communal bank "Banco del Desarrollo" ("Bank of Development"). It is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.
The member is Luisa, who is 48 years old and a single mother of two children. She alternates her daily activities with her yogurt making business, and she also works at a laboratory. Through her independent yogurt making business she gets her children ahead. 
The member wants to expand and improve the yogurt making business and make progress at her job in the laboratory. She requests the loan to purchase supplies to make yogurt, such as sugar, milk and cups by wholesale.
The member is happy to get the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make yogurt, such as sugar, milk and cups by wholesale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from Chokhataur in the Guria region of West Georgia.  She is 42 years old, married, and lives with her family –  her husband Shota, their 21-year-old son, and 19-year-old daughter (a student). 

Irma’s husband is leading the agricultural business for the family. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and sell on average 30 kg of cheese per month. They also have a pig and sell on average 9 piglets per year.  Irma is busy with a trading business. She brings clothes from Tbilisi (the capital of the country) and sells them in the village. She brings clothes twice a month with a total value of 500-800 Laris. The total average monthly profit for the family is 560 Laris (approximately 340 USD). 

Irma requested credit to purchase seasonal clothes for resale.   She plans to use the generated profit to change the roof of their house, as it is already old and can’t keep out the rain and snow.

loans.use: buy seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Badu

texts.en: Badu is in this picture, pouring soup on fufu in an earthen-ware bowl (in her left hand) for one of her customers. She has 4 children. Her husband is a welder. She operates a chop bar (food joint where people come to eat) at Takoradi, which she has done for 2 years. Badu will use the loan to purchase food items to cook and sell.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook.

loans.name: Rachel Group

texts.en:
Rachel is married with three children. Rachel is 37 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rachel sells snacks like polvoron, bread, and bananacue to earn a living and has had this business for almost five years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Rachel is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rachel hopes to be successful in her business so that she could continually support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married and has eight children. Alicia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Alicia is a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4100 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice fields. 

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice fields.

loans.name: Shamer

texts.en: Shamer is 49 years old and lives with her husband and son in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Bayn-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed and her son is a school student. She started her garment retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is increasing steadily however her income is not quite enough to support her family since she's the only breadwinner, therefore, she has rented another counter. Now, her supplies are not enough to fill another whole counter. She is requesting 3,700,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My son will attend college next year, therefore I need to act aggressively to increase my income."

loans.use: To buy stock for her new garment sales counter.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Ufunguo Kipoka Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Kandidus is a 29-year-old father of three children.  One of them attends primary school. He has worked in farming for 2 years, growing coffee, maize, and sugar cane. The lack of fertilizers and insecticides causes problems with his farming activities.  

Kandidus asks for working capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his crops. He is working hard, so as to boost his scale of production from 6 to 11 acres in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, a farmer in Litein, Kenya, is married with six children, four of whom are still in school. She has been farming for 10 years and currently runs her farm with the help of two farmhands.

Esther has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says this will boost her dairy income and enable her to repay the loans and save some income in order to buy better breeds as her business continues to grow. She is focusing on having a strong business base so that she can ensure her children do not drop out of school due to a lack of fees.

She notes an insufficiency in dairy feeds and animal diseases as her major challenges.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has three children. 

Mwanajuma owns a boutique which has been in operation for eleven years. She began her business from the personal savings of informal groups commonly called ‘merry go round’. Mwanajuma is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase clothes, handbags etc. Her main challenge is price fluctuations. She looks forward to opening a cosmetic shop. 

Mwanajuma will use the extra income generated from this loan to purchase a shelf for display.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, handbags etc to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 29 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children between the ages of 3 and 10. Two of them go to school. She sells beer, and she has been doing this business for the past 9 years. With the loan she will buy more crates of beer for resale. With the profits she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beers for resale.

loans.name: Divine Miséricorde 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIVINE MISÉRICORDE 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Marie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 47 ans est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Boniface. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Marie et son mari. Marie n’a pas fréquenté. Pour ce faire, depuis treize ans, Marie vend divers produits alimentaires (conserves, pâtes alimentaires) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Marie vend également des tourteaux. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIVINE MISÉRICORDE 2 un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits alimentaires.

loans.name: Adadjrosso

texts.en:
Mr. Adadjrosso A. was born on October 25, 1960 in Tchékpo-Dédépoè. He is married and the father of 4 children, and has sold drinks as his business for nearly 12 years. This has allowed him to meet the basic needs of his household and contribute to expenses. Holiday periods are busy times for bartenders. He has a good mastery of his profession and has no difficulties in managing the growth of his business. Mr. Adadjrosso A. requests a credit of $1,200 for buying, storing and selling drinks during the upcoming Christmas and New Year holidays. The project, if successful, will allow him to increase his revenue and thus to improve living conditions of his household.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Adadjrosso est né le 25 octobre 1960 à Tchékpo-Dédékpoè. Marié et pèree de 04 enfants, il exerce le commerce de boisson comme activité depuis bientôt 12 ans. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de contribuer de son ménage. Les périodes de fêtes constituent des moments d’intenses activités pour les tenancières de bar. Il maîtrise bien le domaine et n’éprouve aucune difficulté pour bien gérer la croissance de son activité. Monsieur A. Adadjrosso demande alors un crédit de $1200 pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des boissons pendant ces fêtes de Noël et de Nouvel an. Ce projet, s’il se réalise, va lui permettre d’augmenter ses revenus et de ricochet, d’améliorer les conditions de vie dans le ménage.

loans.use: to purchase, stock and sell drinks

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a 19-year-old girl who just completed secondary school. Her parents couldn't afford to put her through university. She therefore decided to go into a business venture. Her parents supported her with start-up capital and she has managed the business ever since on her own.

She needs a loan of $750 to expand the business since her parents who helped her from the begining are no more. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and understands the TEACH Lending program.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 54 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a mason’s assistant at a construction site. Agustina and her family buy wood and make home-made charcoal. They divide the earnings according to each person’s contribution. Agustina sells the charcoal to people in her community and, to increase her income, she washes clothes for other people. With the loan, she wants to buy wood to make charcoal independently. She belongs to the “Morning Flower Group 2”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

AGUSTINA TIENE 54 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL EN UNA CONSTRUCCION. ELLA Y SU FAMILIA COMPRAN MADERA Y PRODUCEN CARBON EN FORMA ARTESANAL, POSTERIORMENTE SE DIVIDEN LA PRODUCCION DEPENDIENDO DEL APORTE DE CADA UNO. AGUSTINA VENDE EL CARBON CON GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD Y PARA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS SALE A LAVAR ROPA AJENA. CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR MADERA PARA HACER CARBON EN FORMA INDEPENDIENTE. PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DEL AMANECER 2.

loans.use: To buy wood to make into charcoal

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en: Clemencia G. C., mother of two, began working at a pasteleria owned by her mother-in-law. Now Clemencia has launched her own business preparing and selling cakes to local primary schools who place bulk orders.  After six successful years, she expanded her business to sell ¨chuños¨, dehydrated potatoes.  She now hopes to expand her business even further to sell other varieties of potatoes.  She is asking for a $325 loan to propel her business to the next level.

loans.use: Increase the variety of potatoes sold.

loans.name: Maharram

texts.ru:
Maharram S. was born in 1958 in Agsu. He is married and has 3 children. Maharram S. has been a barber for more than 29 years. To improve the quality of his service, Maharram wants to purchase modern equipment and needs this loan to pay for it.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Салахов Магеррам родилься 1958 году в городе Аксу. Имеет троих детей.Хороший семьянин, более 29-ти лет работает парикмахером.Чтобы качественно обслуживать клиентов ему необходимо купить современного оборудования.Поэтому ему нужен кредит.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: I Made Hermanto

texts.id:
In addition to being a crop farmer, Made Hermanto raises cattles. He prepares the green plants to feed his cattles. Since he joined DINARI, Made bought a cattle for 3,500,000 IDR (USD~9,000 IDR) from a friend in a neighboring village and bought wheat pollard for additional feed. Every morning, I Made Hermanto washes his cattle to keep it clean. Feeding the cattle and cleaning the stall are done three times a day, morning, noon and afternoon. It took him two hours to complete the tasks. The rest of the time was spent working on his crops. The cattle feeds cost him 3,000 IDR per day. After three months, I Made Hermanto sells his cattle and plans on getting another cattle to be raised again. A cattle was sold for 4,900,000 IDR with a net profit of 1,000,000 IDR in three months. With the loan, Made Hermanto plans on adding more cattle to increase his income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ditengah tengah kesibukan sebagi petani Made Hermanto melengkapi usahanya dengan memelihara sapi. Persiapan pakan hijauan memang disediakan dari dulu untuk memenuhi pakannya. Semenjak bergabung menjadi client Yayasan DINARI Made membeli satu ekor sapi dengan harga Rp.3.500.000,- dari temannya yang ada di desa tetangga dan membeli dedak gandum sebagai pakan jadi untuk pakan tambahan. Setiap pagi, I Made Hermanto selalu memandikan sapinya agar kebersiahan dan kesehatannya terjaga. Pembersihan kandang dan pemberian pakan dilakukan dalam sehari sebanyak tiga kali yaitu pagi, siang dan sore. Waktu yang diperlukan hanya dua jam saja.Waktu selebihnya dipakai untuk bekerja dan mengurus kebunnya untuk menambah pemasukan keuangan dalam keluarganya. Biaya pakan dalam setiap hari mencapai Rp. 3.000,-. Setelah tiga bulan masa pemeliharaan, I Made Hermanto menjual sapinya dan rencananya akan membeli lagi sapi dengan harga yang lebih murah dan dipelihara kembali. Sapi dijual dengan harga Rp.4.900.000,-dengan keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 1.000.000,- dalam tiga bulan pelihara. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Made Hermanto berencana untuk menambah populasi sapinya agar pendapatannya dari beternak sapi lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To buy cattle and to build a nice and clean stall

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano K. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 3 children. She works in the Joint-Stock company “Navbakhor" in the commercial industry of the ladies' dresses and fancy clothing. She has been the client of MicroInvest from 2006 and works with MicroInvest because she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She is very experienced and her total work experience consists of 22 years. Now R. K. requires the loan for the purchase of winter-weight materials that she would like to use in future dressmaking.

loans.use: To puchase winter-weight materials

loans.name: Nabulezi B Group

texts.en: Beatrice W. is married and has two children. She operates a public pay phone which people in her area use when they need to make calls. She and her colleagues have applied for a loan to buy more airtime cards to sell to their customers. Beatrice plans to use the extra income to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime cards to sell to customers who would like to make phone calls

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: NawA., 38 years old, works and lives with her family in Aley. She has two children whom she takes care of. She is an experienced tailor who needs a loan to buy materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Aisha's Raha Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 6 years old. Aisha owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 7.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have a beauty salon, a shop and sell charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Agoro

texts.en: Agoro N.  sells green leafs and okra in her community.  She is 45 years of age, with 5 children and is still energetic and determined to expand her business. She hails from Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. Agoro has being borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She is requesting a loan of  $450 to enable her to buy more green leafs and plantains in order for her to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more green leafs and plantains for sale

loans.name: Solanyi

texts.en:
Solanyi is a brave woman who works hard to fend for her two sons aged seven and twelve years old.  Solanyi sells women’s clothing in the Don Gregorio community of San Cristobal.  According to her,  this business has been the principal source of income for her family over the last five years.   

Currently, Solanyi plans to increase her inventory to increase her sales.  As her children are growing, it is becoming much more difficult for her to make her ends meet.

She hopes that this loan (the fifth she’ll receive from FSMA) will help her move her business forward and provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of more clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Rosas Group

texts.es:
The Banco Comunal Rosas is a group that was recently started with 26 associates.

The group's members run different kinds of businesses such as selling groceries, cheese, drinks, clothing, candy, food, vegetables, arts and crafts, hardware, juices and young animals. They sell their wares from their homes or by traveling door-to-door.

The members need different loan amounts: some of 300 soles, 600 soles, 1,000 soles, making a total loan of 13,600 soles.

These loans will be invested in the purchases of rice, sugar, oil, meat, fruit, gas, pants, sweaters, cassocks, cheeses, tomatoes, onions, cookies, chocolates, and crafts.

The members' dreams are to build houses, establish businesses, proviD. an education to their children, and be professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Rosas, es un Banco que recién inicia con 26 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. abarrotes, quesos, bebidas, ropa, golosinas, comida, verduras, artesanía, artículos D. ferretería, elaboración D. jugos y animales menores. Sus ventas lo realizan en sus domicilios, ambulatoriamente y reparten a domicilio.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,600 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, frutas, gaseosas, pantalones, chompas, casacas, quesos, tomate, cebolla, galletas, chocolates y artesanías.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, establecer su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: These loans will be invested in the purchases of rice, sugar, oil, meat, fruit, gas, pants, sweaters, cassocks, cheeses, tomatoes, onions, cookies, chocolates, and crafts.

loans.name: Petivia

texts.en:
Petivia S., 35, is married with 3 children and lives at Vailele, Upolu Island, Samoa. She has 2 years of experience selling barbecued foods to the villagers and the general public 3 days per week.

Petivia has a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (US$83). SPBD loans are Petivia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase mutton flaps (high-fat cuts of sheep), chicken franks, soya, onions, and salt for her barbecue.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for barbecue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of consumables

loans.name: Shemsa's Charcoala And Firewood Sales Group

texts.en:
