Shemsa is married with three children, aged seven, three, and one years old. Since 1999, she has been selling charcoal and firewood. She works daily from 6am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Shemsa is requesting a loan of $525 loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have their own businesses selling tomatoes, vegetables, juice, and ice-cream.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthorn C., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Channy Eng, 30, live in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have two children, one son and one daughter, who study in the local school.

Mr. Bunthorn has been a mason since 1992, while Mrs. Channy has been a garment factory worker for eight years. The couple is in the process of repairing their house and lacks money to finish some parts of the wall of the house. They also need to dig one well to use for the family. Therefore, Bunthorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to dig one well and finish the remaining part of house wall.

loans.use: To dig one well and complete the wall of his house

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna B., mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Centre 2 C depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des thioubs (tissus teintés) et revendre à Dakar. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna B., married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Centre 2 C for 4 and a half years. She wants to boost her business which consists of buying "thioubs" (lengths of hand-dyed cloth) to re-sell in Dakar. The income from her business allows her to help support the family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of lengths of dyed cloth

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth, de 33 años de edad, vive son su conviviente y sus tres hijos. Vender comida es la actividad diaria que tiene la señora Janeth, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 4 años, sus esfuerzos por prosperar y crecer en su negocio son motivados por sus tres hijos a quienes solventa sus gastos escolares. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y preparar bien la comida a vender, para que los mismos se sientan satisfechos. Le es rentable porque es la única persona que vende comida por su zona. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará sillas y mesas, para dar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Janeth is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. Ms Janeth makes a living selling food; she has had this business for the past 4 years. Her efforts to have her business thrive and expand are motivated by her three children, whose education she is responsible for paying. What she enjoys most in her work is giving good customer service to her clients and preparing good food to sell, so that her clients are satisfied. Her business is profitable because she is the only person selling food in her area. This is her first loan with MFP. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy chairs and tables, so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Lhurielyn

texts.en:
“I started worrying about the cost of sending all of my children to school," says Lhurielyn V., a 40-year-old mother from Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  “I become very reluctant when it comes to school fees because I know that paying them would reduce our family budget," she added. But when she joined the CEVI credit program, she started to raise pigs and sell them to Mr. Pitagara, a meat retailer. From this, she earned enough money for herself and her family. Now, she no longer worries about where to get the money for school fees.

Lhurielyn would like to increase the size of her pig fence. She needs a loan of $125 to purchase additional piglets to raise. She also is willing to invest in other lines of business.

CEVI continues to help Lhurielyn sustain her business. Through credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage it offers, she can accomplish more in her chosen ventures.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil K. is a hard-working businessman. He is 45 years old and married. He is a loving and caring father to 3 school-going children. Jamil has 5 years' experience in the retail business and he is based in Kawempe.

He is using the loan proceeds to replenish his stock of sugar, flour, rice and soap. His business has enabled him to care for his family. Jamil’s dream is to open up a wholesale shop in Kawempe.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, rice and soap for his little store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes H. C. es una cliente muy responsable y muy conocida por la institución, es propietaria de una pensión restaurante y su esposo es propietario de dos radio taxis.
Son una pareja muy joven y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo duro lograron todo lo que tienen ahora, el crédito desembolsado lo invertirán en mejorar la imagen de su pensión restaurante con la compra de sillas y mesas nuevas.
Tiene tres niños pequeños a su cargo y pensando en su bienestar y futuro es que ellos se esfuerzan y trabajan duro, con el tiempo piensan en ampliar su pensión y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes H. C. is a very responsible client and our organization knows her well. She owns a pension-restaurant and her husband owns two radio-taxis. They are a young, strong couple who have worked very hard to get where they are. They plan to use their loan to upgrade the look of the pension-restaurant with new tables and chairs. They have three children to care for, whose well being and futures are their reason for working and trying so hard. In time they plan to expand the pension so they can earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Gloria Rita

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Gloria es conviviente tiene 34 años, un hijo de 1 año. 
Ella trabajaba con su mamá en la venta embutidos, pero su mama viajo a provincia  a Yauca y dejo de vender  ella se quedo con el negocio obtuvo más clientes, ahora su mamá le envía quesos  y aceitunas para que venda. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para las compras de queso, aceituna negras y secas.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió el movimiento del negocio, aprende como las demás socias  invierten y usan estrategias, para mejorar su negocio, ve muchas mujeres esforzadas, y eso le anima mucho.
El sueño de Gloria es crecer más en el negocio, tener un puesto en el mercado y  personas que trabajen para ella.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Los Claves Village Bank. She is 34, and has a common-law husband and a one-year-old baby. She had been working with her mother selling sausages, but her mother has stopped selling and gone to the Yauca province, leaving Gloria with the business. She has gotten a lot of clients, and now her mother sends her cheeses and olives to sell. Gloria needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy cheeses, black olives, and sun-dried olives. Since she's been with Finca she has learned how a business operates. She's learning how the other members invest and strategize, so now she can improve her own business. She sees a lot of hard-working women, which really motivates her. Her dreams include growing her business even more, having a stand at the market, and hiring people to work for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gloria needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy cheeses, black olives, and sun-dried olives.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 38 years old and married to Duedy A., a farmer. The couple has three children: Deo, 20 years old, high school graduate; Jhon Rey - 17 years old, 1st year college; and their youngest is Romel - 9 years old, now in grade three. Her family resides in the rural area of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela.

Analyn has managed a hog raising business for almost a year. She is now planning to borrow from the lenders an amount of PHP5,000.00 in order to sustain the daily feed supply for her hogs. She hopes that her business will grow so she can further help her husband to support the needs of their family, especially the educational needs of their children.

“There is a reason for everything,” says Analyn. This simple quotation made her think of the possibilities of her ambitions in life, simply by believing and entrusting everything to the Lord.

loans.use: To purchase feed.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn R. and her husband live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with their two teenage children, both of whom are students in the local public school. Mrs. R. earns a living by making silk skirts by hand. On a typical day, she makes one or two skirts for her customers. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. To expand her business and  earn additional income, Mrs. R. is applying for a loan to buy more of the raw materials she uses to make skirts.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to use in making skirts.

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is married and has one daughter who is 18 years old. She rents a space in a store and sells work clothing. This is a unique business. She provides work clothing for construction workers and various repair workers. Her profit is about 3,000 UAH per month.

Alena would like to develop her business and have even more clients. She wants to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. This would allow Alena to provide clothing for an even bigger number of workers and receive additional income.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru:
Умед Шерматов родился в 1985 году, недавно женился на Ёркиной. Очень счастлив.Благодаря  животноводству, которым он занимается уже 6 лет, он сыграл свадьбу. Дома у Умеда 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откормом и перепродажей которых он занимается. Умед хочет купить дойную корову, так как жена Умеда будет перерабатывать молоко и продавать его, чтобы принять участие в доходе семьи.
Для этого, он запрашивает сумму 700 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев.
Дополнительный доход в их "новоиспеченную" семью приносит работа Умеда методистом в Городском Отделе Народного Образования (ГРОНО).
texts.en:
Umed S. was born in 1985. He recently married Yorkina, and is very happy. Thanks to raising livestock, which he has done for the past six years, he was able to have a wedding. At home Umed has seven head of large-horned cattle, which he raises and resells. Umed would like to purchase a milk cow, so his wife can process and sell the milk and help support the family. In order to do so, Umed has requested a loan in the amount of 700 somoni. Umed brings additional income into their new-fledged family, working as a teaching specialist at the City Board of Public Education.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement est composé d’une fille et de cinq(5) hommes, qui s’activent respectivement dans la couture et  au sein d’un   même atelier de couture, le  transport l’aviculture ; et le commerce. Ce groupe de jeunes dont la moyenne d’âge  est de 27ans habite a Mbour ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar le prêt sollicité leur permet de développer leur activité respective.
texts.en:
This group is composed of one girl and 4 men, who are active in sewing, in the same sewing workshop, transporting poultry, and commerce respectively. This group of young people whose average age is 27 live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar. The requested loan will permit them to develop their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their little businesses

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna always reminds herself that “poverty is not a hindrance to success.” She is a simple woman who always strives to succeed through her patience and diligence in maintaining her vending business. She is a resident of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela. She is 46 years old and is determined to send her children to school. 

Lorna is a vegetable vendor. Every morning, she buys vegetables wholesale from the public market of Ilagan and sells at retail price in her village. To further improve her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional capital. She and her husband are sacrificing a lot to provide the needs of their family and support their children’s education. She knows that a positive attitude will help in reaching her goals in life. No matter how difficult life may be, she does not consider it as a reason to give up for she strives to become successful someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lelia Luz Buenaventura

texts.es:
La señora Lelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera  con 02 hijos, 01  a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Odria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes, negocio con el que se inició como empresaria.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ropa, tiene pedidos, trae sus productos desde Arequipa.

Su deseo es poner un bazar bien surtido.

A ella le gustan la armonía y el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Lelia belongs to the “Medalla Milagrosa” Community Bank in the district of Pomata, Chucuito province, Peru. She is a 49-year-old sing mother of two children, one who is still under her care, and lives on Odria Street. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past two years, and her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to purchase grocery supplies to start her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of 600 soles to purchase clothing. She has orders to fill, and she brings her products in from Arequipa. Her wish is to set up a well-stocked bazaar. She enjoys the harmony and companionship of her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for her store

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is fifty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to eight children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Yaa is a trader. She sells smoked fish. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community and also sells at her local market. Yaa also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy the fish in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children good education.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Турсунова Гулчехра, женщина торгует продуктами питание около дома. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке Афганбазар. Так же она на дому шьет платье на заказ. За  период кредитования она увеличила товарооборот и повысила уровень жизни. На запрашиваемый займ Гулчехра в сезон заготовки варенья на зиму хочет закупить сахара.
texts.en:
Gulchehra T. is a woman who sells food near her house. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Afganbazar. She also sews custom dresses at home. During her credit history she has increased turnover and improved her quality of life. Gulchehra wants to use the loan to buy sugar for the winter as now is the season for preparing jams.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Unidas En La Fe 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Santa J. is a hardworking grandmother supporting her family selling various merchandise, such as clothing, perfume, deodorant, shampoo and kitchen goods. Selling these goods from her home and on the street, Santa is committed to getting products to her customers. She is so committed that she will wake up at 4 a.m. to take a four-hour bus to a large city to prepare her inventory.

Santa is the mother of 12 children, of which four live with her along with four grandchildren. She finds herself needing to use any profits to support the household with food and electricity. Her husband makes extra money creating and selling carbon for cooking.

Living with far too many people in too small of a house, Santa is hoping that with time, she will save enough money to improve her home. She describes the need to create more space for the 10 people living under her roof. She is thankful for the opportunity to take out her third loan with the hope of an improved business.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: Clothing, perfume, deodorant, shampoo, kitchen and other various goods

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 30 years old and is a divorced mother with four kids who are in school. She has been a food vendor for four years now. She prepares and sells beans and gari (roasted cassava) with ripe plantain. She serves a large number of customers. Ripe plantain with beans, as we call it, is a delicacy that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday either as breakfast or lunch.

Adwoa’s business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, grains, oil, vegetables, plantains and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family’s well being. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of grains, beans, gari, vegetables, ripe plantains and assorted meat

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario H. Sevogia is a client of our enterprise, and he is the employee of a service station 4 km east of the city. He also has a place in his own house where people can pay bills on Mondays. He has one son with Jorgelina Quiroga Trinidad, and she also sells clothes independently.

They work very hard and demonstrate a good history of repayment with our Foundation. With the loan they plan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 50 years old and widowed with six children between the ages of 16 and 26 years old. Three of her children go to school. She resides in, and owns, a four room house where she is staying with six people. Teddy takes care of additional family members, too. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. 

Teddy has a stall for selling food at her home, so she doesn’t pay rent nor monthly market dues. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for six years, servicing her third loan. She doesn’t pay rent for business premises, but pays weekly market expenses of 2000/=. 

Teddy buys bananas from vendors with delivery trucks, who get them from villages, and so she doesn’t incur transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and increasing prices due to persistent drought in many villages in Uganda. Teddy wants to use this loan to buy more sacks and bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and start selling only on wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat S., 34 has been married to Mr. Voeun Nhoem, 33, since 2006. They have a young son. The couple lives in a small village off of National Road Number 2 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sinat’s old mother also lives with the family.

Sinat has been a silk weaver for more than 5 years, while her husband has been a construction worker for 2 years.

Because silk weaving is the business that Sinat has run for long time and it’s her main source of income, she is asking for a loan of US$150 to purchase silk materials (raw silk) to continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her silk  weaving business.

loans.name: Immaculée Amédée

texts.fr: W. Immaculée Amédée est née le 02 Décembre 1969 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Immaculée Amédée est mariée à DJAGA Anatole un commerçant. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C’est Anatole qui supporte les charges de la famille. Immaculée Amédée s’est arrêtée au cours primaire à l’école, et depuis deux ans, elle vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons, pommades, papier hygiénique, lait, conserves, sardine, bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique. Immaculée Amédée vend également des liqueurs dans sa boutique. Immaculée Amédée s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Immaculée Amédée a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé un crédit qui a été bien remboursé. En vue d’agrandir sa boutique et de satisfaire davantage la demande de sa clientèle, Immaculée Amédée sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Immaculée Amédée W. was born on December 2, 1969 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin. Immaculée Amédée is married to Anatole Djaga, a vendor. The couple has two children who are both in school. Anatole takes care of the family's expenses. Immaculée Amédée dropped out of elementary school, and for the past two years she has sold various items (pasta, soap, ointment, toilet paper, milk, canned goods, sardines, candles, etc.) in her shop. Immaculée Amédée also sells liqueurs in her boutique. She gets her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already received one loan through Alidé which she repaid in full. Immaculée Amédée is requesting a second loan through Alidé to increase the size of her boutique and to better meet her customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items (4 boxes of soap, 3 boxes of prepackaged sugar, 6 boxes of bottled liqueur)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
To earn a living, Sun T. sells baskets that she weaves. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. Another source of family income comes from her husband’s taxi-driving job. Sun has five kids; three are married and two are single. One of her sons is employed.

Recently, Sun ran out of the raw materials needed for weaving her baskets, and so she hopes to acquire more. That is why she decided to seek a loan through Kiva for buying materials for her basket-weaving business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her weaving basket business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen P. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Belen owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Belen is just starting this business.
In 2009, Belen joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthy Soa Village Bank Group

texts.en: This is a village bank loan with fourteen members, and they all live in Knong Prek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chanthy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Choeurn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Aside from this they are vegetable sellers in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so Mrs. Chanthy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. Mrs. Chanthy S. is a mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J. is currently in the business of selling food in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more chairs and tables.  Mary is 31 years old. Her husband is a mechanic. She has four children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bigger restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William M. Masinde is farmer who plants and sells maize.  He started his business in 2005.

Before this, he sold poultry but had to quit because the market was not good and his income was too low. 

He is 50 years old and married with six children.  His future plans are to educate his children and begin dairy farming. To expand his business and work towards his goals he is requesting a loan of 25000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more seed to expand maize farming

loans.name: Las Rachoquelenses Group

texts.es: Son personas que residen a una distancia de 20 kilómetros de la ciudad de Momostenango, las integrantes del grupo se dedican mayormente al comercio y a la venta de ropa, también a la crianza de cerdos, cuentan con ganados bovinos, y se dedican a la compra y venta de canastas regionales y típicas, actualmente quieren incrementar el negocio con la que cuentan ya que en estos tiempos las ventas han bajado considerablemente, debido a que existe competencia sobre el mismo oficio, necesitan un préstamo para que puedan aumentar de capital para poder surtir su mercancía, y de esa manera poder incrementar sus ventar como también los ingresos económicos, esto contribuye a que las familias de cada una de ellas mejore sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
They are persons who live 20 kilometers away from the city of Momostenango. The members of the group are, for the most part, in clothing sales and commerce. Some raise pigs and cattle, others are regional and typical basket merchants. They all seek to help their businesses grow and at this time, when sales have declined considerably due to competition in the same areas, they need funding to stock merchandise so that they can increase sales and profits. This contributes to the improvement of each of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es: Julia Maritza M. J. de 30 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, los cuales depende por completo de Julia, ya que ella es madre soltera y no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda por parte de otras personas. Ella trabaja elaborando trapeadores, los cuales posteriormente sale a vender por las calles de Soyapango y que también comercializa en su propio hogar. Julia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela para poder elaborar los trapeadores y así mismo poder vender mayor cantidad de estos. Ella es una persona que trabaja mucho por el bienestar de su familia, es por esta razón que solicita dicho préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder mejorar su negocio, y de esta manera obtener mejores ventas las cuales se reflejen en su hogar, obteniendo una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella pero principalmente para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia Maritza M. J. is 30 years old and resides in Soyapango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her two dependent children, ages 5 and 2. Julia is a single mother and does not receive any type of help from other people. She manufactures mops and sells them later on the streets of Soyapango and also from her own home.

Julia is requesting a loan so that she can buy cloth in large quantities for making mops so that she can sell them in bulk. She is a person who works extremely hard for the welfare of her family, which is why she is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral. Julia desires to improve her business so that she can generate better sales to be reflected in her home and obtain a better quality of life for herself, but mainly for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth for making mops

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 46 year old married man with four children in school.  He has been farming for fifteen years.  He does dairy farming as well as growing tea and vegetables for commercial use.  He sells his farm produce to area residents and transports some to other provinces in the country.  Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy a cow which has increased his production.  

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to top up to his savings and buy a pick-up to ease transport.  He hopes to buy a lorry in the future.  George has big dreams for the future, he dreams of becoming the main supplier of vegetables in his area and owning a shop for selling animal feed.

loans.use: To buy a pick-up for transporting farm produce

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is married and lives with her two lovely children. Her husband is a driver. Akua uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the family. She has received junior high education.

Akua sells bags of salt at Jukwa. She will use the loan to purchase additional bags of salt to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to save to acquire a shop in the market to display her salt.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of salt to sell

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school. He runs a taxi business to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years now. He says that he has a good customer base due to his experience and good customer care skills. He describes himself as an ambitious and hardworking man. 

Douglas saves his money on a weekly basis with a group in Faulu Kenya called C. Market. The group enables him to access loans with group guarantees. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to paint his car so that he can attract more customers. He hopes to grow his business and buy more vehicles in the future.

loans.use: To paint his vehicle

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van L., who lives in Ta Pech village in Kandal province, was born in 1967. She and her husband, Mr. Phat Phan, are farmers who own a one-hectare  plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they try to work hard they can earn little income because their rice field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So, to improve the rice production, Mrs. Van L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and the rest of the loan will go to rent a plow to plow her rice field. Through this activity, they support four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to rent a plow

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. is from the village of Calaran Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Anita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vital plus products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, de 24 años, vive en una casa alquilada al lado de su pareja Ramón (31) y de sus dos pequeños hijos.Desde hace 4 años, cultiva papa, alverja, maíz, habas y verduras, junto con su esposo, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados, en tiempo de cosecha obtiene regulares ganancias de la venta de sus productos. También cría  animales menores como gallinas, cuyes  y cerdos, que utiliza para consumo familiar, también los vende cuando necesita cubrir algún gasto doméstico. Lo que más le gusta es vivir en la chacra y disfrutar de la tranquilidad del campo, sin embargo le disgusta regar durante la noche sus sembríos. El objetivo de esta joven pareja es brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, por eso evitan que les falte algo, y como Cecilia, sabe que sus cosechas serán bastante productivas, las cuida adecuadamente. Para mas adelante piensa sembrar mayor cantidad de  productos que se desarrollan en esta parte de la sierra central.Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  confía en que pagará puntualmente cada cuota, porque considera que es la única manera de demostrar el agradecimiento que tiene con la entidad, además porque quiere continuar en su banco comunal donde le gusta laborar.Cecilia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  2 toros pequeños, los cuales ensebará para luego venderlos a mayor precio y así obtendrá mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old. She lives in a rented house along with her partner Ramón (31) and their two small children. For the past four years she has been growing potatoes, peas, corn, lima beans and vegetables along with her husband on their own land and land that they rent. During the harvest period they have regular earnings from the sales of their products. They also raise young animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs that they use for food. They also sell these animals in order to cover household expenses. What they like the best is to live among the fields and enjoy the tranquility of the countryside. Never the less, Cecilia doesn’t like to water her crops at night. The goal of this young pair is to provide the best for their children. They try to provide for their needs and know that they need an adequate harvest in order to do so. In the future they hope to grow more crops that can be developed in the central mountains. This is the sixth loan they have requested with MFP. They are confident they can make the payments on time. They consider timely payments the only way they can show how grateful they are to have this entity. They hope to continue working with the community bank. Cecilia plans to invest the loan money in the purchase of two small bulls. They will raise them in order to sell them for a greater price and therefore have more resources.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two young bulls

loans.name: Unidos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Unidos por el Éxito” se encuentra ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano D. el Agustino, representada por  Vilma, quien actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía,  tiene 45 años, con 4 hijos, quienes ya son independientes y han formado su familia.
La alcancía trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace dos años y seis meses, esta  conformada por 10 socios emprendedores quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades en su mismo domicilio y en forma ambulante como: venta D. comida y frituras, venta D. ropa D. vestir, venta D. abarrotes, servicio D. confecciones D. polo, confección y venta D. sabanas, crianza D. porcinos, venta D. productos D. belleza y servicio D. limpieza en hogares.
El destino del reciente préstamo será para la adquisición D. mercadería para surtir sus productos e insumos y materiales para sus negocios. Sus expectativas son tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida, así como también tener una economía más estable para ir mejorando la educación D. sus hijos. Los socios nos encontramos muy entusiasmados y agradecidos y D. poder trabajar con la institución y nos comprometemos a no defraudarlos.
(En la foto niña hija D. la socia).
texts.en:
The “Unidos por el Éxito” (United for Success) communal bank is located in the Agustino settlement. It is represented by Vilma, 45, who is the bank president. She has four children who are independent and have formed their own families. The communal bank has collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the last two-and-a-half years. It has 10 enterprising members that are in a variety of commercial activities in their homes and door-to-door. Some of the activities are: sale of prepared meals and fast food, clothing sales, grocery sales, clothing manufacturing, manufacturing and sales of bed sheets, pig raising, beauty products sales and home cleaning services. The recent loan will be destined to buy merchandise to stock their businesses as well as for ingredients and materials. Their expectations are to have higher income in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life as well as having a more stable income to improve their children’s education. The members are excited and grateful to be able to work with the institution and pledge to meet their obligations. (A member’s daughter appears in the photo)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items, ingredients and merchandise for their businesses.

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
Tufa P. is 53 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro, which she then sells.  Tufa has four years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use her earnings (estimated to be 400 talas or US$167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Tufa joined SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tufa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii and Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, en moyenne 4  enfants et qui  vivent dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et les  six prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée par TOTON C..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare . 
Après la récolte,la production est vendue à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000fcfa par campagne,qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’apporter sa contribution dans les dépenses familiales.
Elle souhaite continuer cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace culturale encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who average 37 years of age with an average of four children each; they live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their seventh loan from the institution and the six previous loans were all repaid correctly. The crop cultivated by Toton C. is rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment to maintain her half a hectare of land. Once the crop has been harvested, it is sold to a customer base made up of men and women in the village and at the market in Loulouni. She is planning to make an average profit of 30,000 FCFA during the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to make a contribution to the family expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and small farming materials

loans.name: Mr. Bol Va Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Bol V., village bank president, born in 1980, comes from Thum village, Takeo province. The fifteen members of the village bank who elected him will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their current businesses.

Mr. Bol V. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Phearum P., is a salesperson at the local market where she can earn a large profit to support her family. Mr. Bol V.'s problem is that his wife does not have a motorcycle to transport items for her business. So to improve this business, Mr. Bol V. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle. He is the father of two children both of whom are too young to work or study. 

On the day of the loan disbursement, Mr. Bol V. was busy working in the field. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Phearum P., received the loan for him.  Mr. Bol V.'s wife is in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for  transportation of business goods

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Carlos, reside en el municipio de San Rafael Oriente en San Miguel, es casado, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de un año de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura. El aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que sus padres le enseñaron y él lo desarrolla desde hace siete años para el sustento de su familia. El en este momento está solicitando un préstamo que lo utilizara para la siembra de Maíz y Frijol comprando los insumos necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha como lo es el abono. Este contribuirá para obtener una mejor producción de granos básicos, mejorando las condiciones de vida de esta familia.
Don Carlos aspira continuar trabajando la tierra, apoyar a sus hijos con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the municipality of San Rafael Oriente in San Miguel. He is married and lives with his wife, and they have a 1 year-old son. He is a farmer. He learned to work the land because his parents taught him; he has been doing this work for 7 years to support his family. Now he is requesting a loan that he will use to plant corn and beans, buying the supplies he needs to obtain a good harvest, like fertilizer. This will help him to increase his production of basic grains, improving the conditions of life for his family. Carlos wants to continue working the land, to support his children with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate corn and beans

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old and is married. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Naomi Mumbi

texts.en:
Naomi has operated her shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. She is 25 years old, married to Samuel Kisinga and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her first loan in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy dry food stuff in bulk including sugar, rice, flour and salt, to sell.

Naomi hopes to grow her retail shop into a whole-sale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy dry food stuff in bulk including sugar, rice, flour and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, una mujer alegre y trabajadora de 46 años; está casada con Alejandro, de 47 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos. Gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo de ellos lograron sacar adelante a 2 de sus primeros hijos, y ahora solo viven con los 3 últimos; todos ellos menores de edad. A las afueras de la ciudad de Tarma, en la parte alta del cerro, ahí donde se ubica el Centro Poblado de Santa Clara, encontramos los sembríos de Sabina. Hace 30 años que se dedica a la agricultura, desde que era adolescente, sus padres le otorgaron un parcela, que con el tiempo y, las buenas ganancias que dejó sus cultivos de papa, la ayudaron a adquirí más adelante muchos terrenos agrícolas, donde hoy siembra gran cantidad de papa. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Sabina, ella también cría vacas, las alimenta y cuida con mucho esmero ya que sabe, que de ello depende su producción de queso, el cual vende al por mayor en el mercado central de su ciudad. Por el trabajo de tantos años, ella quiere abrir un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de tubérculos, ya que su experiencia garantiza su éxito. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y está muy satisfecha de las facilidades que le da su banco comunal, para poder salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará abono orgánico, con ello quiere asegurar su producción de papa en sus diferentes variedades (yungay, pericholi y de color).
texts.en: Sabina is a very happy and hard working woman. She is 46 years old and she is married with Alejandro, 47 years old, and they have 5 children together. It is thanks to their combined hard work that they were able to support their 2 eldest children. And now they only live with their three school-aged children. In the outskirts of the city of Tarma, in the plateau region of the mountains is the Centro Poblado de Santa Clara. There is where we find Sabina and her plantations. For more than 30 years she has been an agriculturist. When she was and adolescent her parents gave her a parcel of land. With time and with the good earnings yielded from her potato plantation she was able to purchase much more land. Today she harvests potatoes in great quantities. But this is not Sabina's only business. She is also a cattle farmer. She feeds them and shepherd's them with great care, knowing that it directly relates to the cheese produced.  She sells cheese in wholesale in the central market of the city.  For having worked for so many years she wishes to open a small business, buying and selling tubers, especially because her vast experience guarantees its success. This is her ninth loan she requests through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy with the support provided to her through her community bank.  This loan will be used to purchase organic fertilizer to secure her potato harvest. She sows potatoes of different varieties: yungay, pericholi and colored potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to secure her potato harvest.

loans.name: Saed A Dein

texts.en:
Saed a Dein is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. Saed owns a tailoring workshop. He works with his brothers in the workshop, which is the only source of income for the family. Saed came to Kiva's partner, FATEN, to take out a loan to purchase another tailoring machine and fabric. He wants to meet customer demand, especially now that feast is around the corner, and the workshop needs to increase production. The new sewing machine will help expand the project and provide work opportunities for more people in need of work.

Saed appears in the workshop in the photo.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 3 hijas mayores y sus respectivas familias, aunque esta dama no tiene hijos menores a su cargo se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años atiende su negocio de venta de golosinas, gaseosas y cervezas que tiene en la puerta de su casa. Esta muy satisfecha ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a sus hijas en la crianza de sus nietas, que según sus palabras son el tesoro que la vida le ha dado. Ella empieza sus labores desde muy temprano y empieza en la atención  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta la noche. Le gustan las ventas pues es una actividad bastante tranquila que le permite trabajar en la comodidad de su casa; pero lo que le desagrada es que no puede salir muy seguido porque descuidaría su negocio. Esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de su grupo. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y surtirlo con mayor cantidad de mercadería. Es el crédito número 12 con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Julia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería e ingredientes para surtir mejor su negocio, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Julia is 60 years old.  She lives in her own home with the company of her 3 eldest daughters and their respective families.  Although this lady doesn't have young children in her care she works every day to get ahead in life.  For the past 5 years she has worked in her business selling sweets, soda pop, and beers from the door of her home.  She is very satisfied as she gets regular earnings that allow her to help her daughters to raise her grandchildren, which in her words are the treasures that life has given her.  She begins her work very early and attends her shop from 10 in the morning until night.  She likes sales because it is a fairly tranquil activity that allows her to work in the comfort of her home; but she doesn't like that she can't go out very often because it would neglect her business.  She is very happy with the performance of her group.  In the future, she plans to grow her business and to stock it with a larger quantity of merchandise.  This is her 12th loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually as she doesn't want to displease the people who make possible the support that will permit her to continue working in the pursuit of progress.  Julia plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of some merchandise and ingredients to better stock her business, and in this manner she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock Julia's snack shop

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher has been mixed farming and employing two farmhands in her hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya for over ten years.She is married with  six children aged between twenty four and nine years. Her produce of milk, vegetables and tomatoes are sold locally.

She has requested for this loan of 48,000 KES  from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow .She had once requested a first time loan of 30,000 KES. She says the milk produce will act as food supplement for the family and also pay for the children's school fees. She is optimistic that she will soon have a mini-chilling plant to store the milk and avoid wastage.

She says diseases are a major problem  and eats into her income since the animals must be treated.She recommends Juhudi loans because of their flexibility.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina G. is from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Felina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Felina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Tsereenjav

texts.en: Tsereenjav N. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, wihtin his brother's fence. Tseveenjav and his wife both operate a taxi service in their town using their own car. He began his taxi business after working and living as a herder in the countryside for several years. Today, their daily business earnings exceed 25,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). For the future, he plans to sell his small car and buy a larger truck at 2,000,000 MNT with 1.5 tons of capacity in order to start operating a transportation business to increase his profits. He has used his earnings to improve his family's standard of living. Tseveenjav is a modest man and says, "I plan to pay off this loan fully on time and buy my own plot of land and fence for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan for half of the vehicle's price in order to purchase a truck.

loans.use: To purchase a truck

loans.name: 18 Of September Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “18 DE SEPTIEMBRE” es un grupo de 9 mujeres que han decidido formar esta banca comunal para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  La B. C. “18 DE SEPTIEMBRE”,  es parte del centro focal de SANTIAGO II, están iniciando su cuarto ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos tanto de servicio como comercio. Entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de regalos, vajilla y papel de regalo, venta de fruta, venta de ropa, peluquería, venta de medias, confección de mantas y polleras.
Para su organización, la B. C.  18 DE SEPTIEMBRE cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Maria, una tesorera, la señora  Eulogia y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Evelia.
 
La Presidenta, la señora María, vive con su  esposo y su  hijo.   El negocio de la señora   Maria es la venta de vajillas.  El mismo fue aprendido de la hermana, hace cinco años, le ayuda el esposo en las ventas.   El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.2500.- y será destinado para la compra de vajilla.

La señora presidenta ya ha sido socia de  Pro Mujer dos años,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde “la capacitación”.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "18 of September" is a group of 9 women who decided to form this communal bank in order to receive a loan, support, and health care. The communal bank "18 of September" is a member of the central organization Santiago II, and they are on their fourth loan cycle. 

Each of the members has their own business, of various types and services, such as commerce. Among them are: clothing sales, souvenir sales, dinnerware and gift wrapping sales, fruit sales, hair salon, stockings sales, and seamstress. 

In their group, the communal bank "18 of September" has a leadership group made up of the leader, Maria, a treasurer, Eulogia, and a secretary, Evelia. 

The leader of the group, Maria, lives with her husband and their son. Maria's business is the sale of dinnerware. She learned the business from her sister five years ago, and her husband helps her with the sales. The loan requested is in the amount of 2500 Bs. and it will be used to purchase dinnerware. 

The leader of the group has been a member of Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) for two years. When she was asked what she likes about the organization, she said "the loan process".

loans.use: To purchase dinnerware.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 52 سنة متزوج وله اربعة اولاد يعمل خياطة وتصليح الالبسة له في عمله حوالي 30 سنة يحب عمله ويريد دائما التجدد
والاستمرار في العمل ما يميز عمله انه له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يتميز بالدقة والتجديد في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض
له من المجموعة الى شراء عدة وبضائع جديدة للعمل يحلم بأن يصبح صاحب معمل لبيع الالبسة الجاهزة ولكنه يلقى صعوبة في تحقيق
حلمه فهو يريد البدء من الصفر حتى يستطيع تحقيق هذا الحلم
texts.en: Hasan, 52, is married with four children. He has been working as a tailor for 30 years. Hasan likes his work and always seeks to develop it. His clients are from his neighbors and people who know him. Hasan is known for his thorough and creative work. He wants to get a loan to buy news goods and tools. Hasan wishes to own an outlet for ready- made clothes one day but it is hard for him to achieve this dream. Hasan, however, is keen to achieve his dream so he is working from scratch to reach it.

loans.use: To buy new goods and tools for his sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more seeds and pigs

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza D. 61años, es viuda y vive con una D. sus hijas y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra y cosecha D. papa y maíz, principalmente, ya que estos productos son comercializados en la ciudad más cercana a su zona. La ventas que realiza son al por mayor y menor, D. acuerdo a las oportunidades que se le presenten, D. esta manera tiene los recursos que necesita. Paralelamente a esto cría pollos y ovejas en su granja, es así que su tiempo lo ocupa en la ganadería; pero los fines D. semana los venD., siendo la venta D. pollos que más se realiza. Su entrega al trabajo es lo que la caracteriza, por ello espera intensificarse en la agricultura. Es su  tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar sacos D. abono.
texts.en:
Eliza, 61, is a widow living with one of her daughters and two grandchildren in her own house.  She has been primarily a potato and corn farmer most of her life since these products are sold in the city nearest her zone.  The sales she does are wholesale and retail according to the opportunities that present themselves; this is how she earns the resources she needs.  At the same time, she also raises chickens and sheep at her farm so her time is used to raise livestock.  She sells them on the weekend and what she sells the most is chickens.  She is noted for her devotion to work and because of this she hopes to intensify the farming.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she’s very happy to know she has financial support since she has always been very responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those who will fund the loan she’s asking for that will be very useful for her business’ progress.  

She will use the loan to buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 64 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Víctor de 60 años,  su hija mayor, su yerno y su nieto; juntos buscan progresar cada día. Desde hace 10 años, esta emprendedora mujer empezó con la venta de bijouteria de una marca reconocida de accesorios para mujer. Dice que las ventas son buenas, pues su hija es gerente de la empresa que la provee y compra las joyas a precios mínimos, es por esta razón que ella trabaja apoyada por su hija. Esta muy contenta pues mientras comercializa las joyas a conocidas y amigas puede cuidar de su pequeño nieto ya que su hija se lo encarga mientras ella trabaja. Aunque es sacrificado cuidar a su pequeño nieto, por tanto tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar sus ventas para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de bijouteria, pues quiere comprar nuevos modelos para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en: Rosa is 64 years old.  She lives in her own home along with her husband Victor, who is 60 years old, her eldest daughter, her son-in-law and her grandson.  They work together to get ahead each day.  10 years ago, this enterprising woman began selling costume jewelry of a well known brand for women's accessories.  She says that the sales are good, and her daughter is the manager of the business that supplies her, and so she buys the jewelry at the lowest prices.  This is why she does this, helped by her daughter.  She is very happy that while she sells the jewels to acquaintances and friends she is able to care for her small grandson, as her daughter entrusts him to Rosa while she works.  Although she is sacrificing to care for her small grandson, for a long time she has had many plans for the future, like growing her sales in order to improve her earnings  This is the 7th loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she doesn't want to displease the people who make possible the support that will permit her to continue working in search of progress.  Rosa has planned to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a larger quantity of costume jewelry, and she wants to buy new models in order to offer the best to her clients, and in this manner she hopes to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy more costume jewelry to offer to her clients

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris K. is  41 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She also has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan and Doris opted to assist her with her schooling. In 1999, Doris established her food stuff business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. She opens her business seven days a week, nine hours a day. She is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase large quantities of garri (couscous-like grain), palm oil, and bulgur. Doris intends to use the proceeds of this loan to pay school fees for her children and help her husband provide a livelihood for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase garri, palm oil, and bulgur

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Javier le está haciendo falta colocar el vitropiso, pintar el interior y exterior de la casa. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar las mejorar esta necesitando para que su vivienda este en mejor condición para su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carretera, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Estela con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de salón de belleza. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan una patrimonio seguro y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. José Javier is lacking a tile floor as well as paint on the interior and exterior of his house. At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to complete these improvements so that his home will be in the best condition for his family.

José Javier plans to repay the loan with the earnings he receives from his job at a transportation company where he works as a truck driver. His wife Sra. Maria Estela earns an income from her beauty salon business. They want their children to have a secure inheritance and good living conditions.

loans.use: To install a tile floor and complete the interior and exterior finishes of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna,  tiene 46 años de edad, ella es soltera y sin carga  familiar directa, actualmente vive en el Caserío Las Pampas  a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope

Digna se dedica a la venta  y  crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio está situado enla parte posterior su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Ella suele criar ganado porcino(cerdos), ovino (ovejas), pavos y patos, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de aves menores para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves y cerdos.  

A digna se le conoce como una mujer entregada a su trabajo, or lo que sus vecinos coinciden en que ella es una mujer responsable y respetuosa
texts.en:
Digna is 46 years old, single and doesn't have any immediate family.  She currently lives in the Las Pampas settlement, 5 minutes from the city of Mórrope.

Digna has been raising and selling animals for 10 years.  Her business is located in the back part of her house.  She learned this business from her parents.  Needless to say she knows the business well.  She usually raises cattle, pigs, sheep, ducks and turkeys.  When they reach a good size she sells them to the merchants that always visit the area where she lives.   

She will use the loan to buy smaller birds to fatten and balanced feed for birds and pigs.

Digna is known as a woman who is very dedicated to her work and her neighbors agree that she is a responsible and respected woman.

loans.use: buy smaller birds to fatten and balanced feed for birds and pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 41 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Imelda runs a general store in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. 

Imelda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more products such as canned goods, dry goods, and products needed for home chores. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Imelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as canned goods, dry goods, and household needs

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina  is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Six years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle in order to contribute to the family finances. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Slowly, her number of cows has increased and her clients have started asking for more and more. Madina is not alone in her business as her husband and 2 grown sons help her. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN. She has recommended herself as a super client and has completed the previous loan she took from AqroInvest through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase 4 calves and fodder

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been selling a variety of used clothes in Olkalou town for the last two years. She is 48 years old, and the single mother of five school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell. She wants to take advantage of July, which is a cold season in Olkalou and surrounding towns.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent shop from where to sell, as she currently sells from the roadside.

loans.use: to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: She is currently in the Business of selling . She want to small stock business.  She is 32 years old and married with a husband who is Farmer. She has 4 children and her 2 children go to school, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to run her family smoothly.

loans.use: Small Stock

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children.  She sells maize, rice and other items at Abura, which she has done for some time now.  Her husband is a teacher.  Esi uses her income to assist her partner in the general upkeep of their home.   She will use this loan to purchase more of the above mentioned goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 17, 15 y 12 años D. edad, ella administra una tienda y también venD. tortillas, aprendió por una amiga y su negocio tiene 10 años D. existir, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 9:00pm, en la tienda.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para la tienda, porque necesita surtirla en huevo, pastas, pollo, aceite, arroz, sopas, bebidas y más artículos D. primera necesidad, su propósito es mantener D. todo lo que los clientes le demandan.
Para el futuro espera tener un negocio más granD., tener muchos clientes, y que su familia tenga una condición D. vida mejor.
texts.en:
Graciela lives with her husband and three children aged 17, 15 and 12.  She has a store and also sells tortillas.  She learned this business from a friend, and she has had this store for 10 years.  She works in the store from 6am until 9pm.  

Now she requests a loan to buy merchandise for her store, because she needs to stock it with eggs, pasta, chicken, cooking oil, rice, soups, drinks and other basic consumer goods.  Her goal is to have everything that her customers demand.

In the future she hopes to have a bigger business and a lot of customers, so that her family could have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggs, pasta, chicken, cooking oil, rice, soups and drinks to stock her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is married and has for the last two years earned a living by running a variety store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income on the side by selling food items. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell in her variety store. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
La  Sra. Mila D. 32 años D. edad, casada, con 02 hijos menores D. edad en etapa escolar, es socia D. la Alcancía Comunal Virgen del Rosario , fue socia del anterior ciclo y durante ese periodo demostró ser puntual con las cuotas, es por eso que  este segundo ciclo solicito un nuevo préstamo . La Sra. Mila  se dedica en la  actualidad a  la venta D.  abarrotes desD.  hace 06 años, solicito este préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería y poder incrementar su tienda  con la venta D. frutas y verduras, así poder generar más ingresos. El deseo D. Mila  para el futuro es poder tener una tienda en el centro D. Huancayo ,así poder brindar ,a sus hijos, sus padres una mejor calidad D. vida ,ya que gracias a sus padres,pudo salir adelante con su negocio.                                  
Mila se encuentra ubicada en la foto al último, viste  una casaca color  negro y polo color verD.
texts.en:
Señora Mila is 32 years old and is married with two school-age children. She is a member of the communal bank Alcancía Comunal Virgen del Rosario.  She participated in this group's first loan cycle and during this time showed herself to be punctual with her repayments and is now seeking a second loan.

Señora Mila has been selling groceries for the past six years.  She is seeking this loan so she can buy more merchandise and expand her store with the sale of fruits and vegetables to allow her to increase her income.

Her desire for the future is to be able to have a store in the center of Huancayo, thus being able to bring a better quality of life to her children and her parents, now that thanks to her parents, she has been able to get ahead with her business.

Mila is on the far left of the photo, dressed in a black jacket and green polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 56 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children.

Leonida has been a tailor since 1975.  Aside from tailoring, she has also been engaged in a hog raising business for three years.  She make and repairs men's, women's and kid's clothing.  From the business she manages, she is able to earn about P6,000 a month.  According to Leonida, she uses her income to buy feed, pay for school tuition, to pay electric bills, and for the maintenance of their corn farming.  She would like her child to finish the college level.  For this reason she is doing her best by maintaining and improving the quality of clothing she sews. 

Leonida decided to apply for a loan amounting to P15,000 in order to buy garments and accessories of dress for her tailoring business, and three piglets for her hog raising business.  She is aiming to gain more profits in order to sustain the financial needs and daily needs in their life.

loans.use: to buy garments and accessories of dress for her tailoring business and three piglets for her hog raising business.
